[We]271-we settle down in [[our]271-we new home]272-our new home , and [I]0-i resolve to keep a diary . [Tradesmen]273-tradesmen trouble [us]271-we a bit , so does [the scraper]274-the scraper . [The Curate]72-the curate calls and pays [me]0-i a great compliment . [[My]0-i dear]275-my dear wife [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i have just been a week in [[our]271-we new house]276-our new house , " [The Laurels]74-the laurels , "[72-the curate] [Brickfield Terrace]1-brickfield terrace , [Holloway]2-holloway - [a nice six - roomed residence , not counting [basement with a front breakfast - parlour]278-basement with a front breakfast - parlour]277-a nice six - roomed residence , not counting basement with a front breakfast - parlour . [We]271-we have [a little front garden]279-a little front garden ; and there is a flight of ten steps up to the front door ; which , by - the - by , [we]271-we keep locked with the chain up . [Cummings]75-cummings , [Gowing]76-gowing , and [[our]271-we other intimate friends]280-our other intimate friends always come to the little side entrance , which saves [the servant]281-the servant the trouble of going up to the front door , thereby taking [her]281-the servant from [her]281-the servant work . [We]271-we have [a nice little back garden which runs down to [the railway]283-the railway]282-a nice little back garden which runs down to the railway . [We]271-we were rather afraid of the noise of [the trains]284-the trains at first , but [the landlord]285-the landlord said [we]271-we should not notice [them]284-the trains after a bit , and took £ 2 off the rent . [He]285-the landlord was certainly right ; and beyond the cracking of the garden - wall at the bottom , [we]271-we have suffered no inconvenience .

After [my]0-i work in [the City]286-the city , [I]0-i like to be at [home]287-home . What 's the good of [a home]288-a home , if [you]289-you are never in [it]288-a home ? " [Home]287-home , Sweet Home , "[0-i] that 's [my]0-i motto . [I]0-i am always in of an evening . [[Our]271-we old friend]290-our old friend [Gowing]76-gowing may drop in without ceremony ; so may [Cummings]75-cummings , who lives opposite . [[My]0-i dear wife]291-my dear wife [Caroline]73-carrie and [I]0-i are pleased to see [them]292-them , if [they]292-them like to drop in on [us]271-we . But [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i can manage to pass [our]271-we evenings together without [friends]293-friends . There is always something to be done : a tin - tack here , [a Venetian blind]294-a venetian blind to put straight , a fan to nail up , or part of a carpet to nail down - all of which [I]0-i can do with [my]0-i pipe in [my]0-i mouth ; while [Carrie]73-carrie is not above putting a button on a shirt , mending a pillow - case , or practising the " Sylvia Gavotte "[77-w. bilkson] on [[our]271-we new cottage piano]295-our new cottage piano ( on the three years ' system ) , manufactured by [W. Bilkson]77-w. bilkson ( in small letters ) , from [Collard and Collard]78-collard and collard ( in very large letters ) . It is also a great comfort to [us]271-we to know that [[our]271-we boy]296-our boy [Willie]79-lupin is getting on so well in [the Bank at [Oldham]3-oldham]297-the bank at oldham . [We]271-we should like to see more of [him]79-lupin . Now for [my]0-i diary:- April 3.-Tradesmen called for custom , and [I]0-i promised [Farmerson]80-farmerson , [the ironmonger]298-the ironmonger , to give [him]79-lupin a turn if [I]0-i wanted any nails or tools . By - the - by , that reminds [me]0-i there is no key to [our]271-we bedroom door , and the bells must be seen to . The parlour bell is broken , and the front door rings up in [[the servant]281-the servant 's bedroom]300-the servant 's bedroom , which is ridiculous . [Dear friend [Gowing]76-gowing]301-dear friend gowing dropped in , but would n't stay , saying there was an infernal smell of paint . April 4.-Tradesmen still calling : [Carrie]73-carrie being out , [I]0-i arranged to deal with [Horwin]81-horwin , who seemed [a civil butcher with [a nice clean shop]303-a nice clean shop]302-a civil butcher with a nice clean shop . Ordered a shoulder of mutton for to - morrow , to give [him]81-horwin a trial . [Carrie]73-carrie arranged with [Dorset]82-dorset , [the butterman]304-the butterman , and ordered a pound of fresh butter , and a pound and a half of salt ditto for [kitchen]305-kitchen , and a shilling 's worth of eggs . In the evening , [Cummings]75-cummings unexpectedly dropped in to show [me]0-i a meerschaum pipe [he]81-horwin had won in a raffle in [the City]286-the city , and told [me]0-i to handle it carefully , as it would spoil the colouring if the hand was moist . [He]81-horwin said [he]81-horwin would n't stay , as [he]81-horwin did n't care much for the smell of the paint , and fell over the scraper as [he]81-horwin went out . Must get the scraper removed , or else [I]0-i shall get into a scrape . [I]0-i do n't often make jokes . April 5.-Two [shoulders of mutton]307-shoulders of mutton arrived , [Carrie]73-carrie having arranged with [another butcher]308-another butcher without consulting [me]0-i . [Gowing]76-gowing called , and fell over scraper coming in . Must get that scraper removed . [April]83-april 6.-Eggs for breakfast simply shocking ; sent [them]309-them back to [Borset]84-borset with [my]0-i compliments , and [he]84-borset need n't call any more for orders . Could n't find umbrella , and though it was pouring with rain , had to go without it . [Sarah]85-sarah said [Mr. Gowing]76-gowing must have took it by mistake last night , as there was a stick in the ' all that did n't belong to [nobody]310-nobody . In the evening , hearing [someone]311-someone talking in a loud voice to [the servant in [the downstairs hall]313-the downstairs hall]312-the servant in the downstairs hall , [I]0-i went out to see who it was , and was surprised to find it was [Borset]84-borset , [the butterman , who was both drunk and offensive]314-the butterman , who was both drunk and offensive . [Borset]84-borset , on seeing [me]0-i , said [he]84-borset would be hanged if [he]84-borset would ever serve [City clerks]315-city clerks any more - the game was n't worth the candle . [I]0-i restrained [my]0-i feelings , and quietly remarked that [I]0-i thought it was possible for [a City clerk]316-a city clerk to be [a gentleman]317-a gentleman . [He]84-borset replied [he]84-borset was very glad to hear it , and wanted to know whether [I]0-i had ever come across one , for [he]84-borset had n't . [He]84-borset left [the house]318-the house , slamming the door after [him]84-borset , which nearly broke the fanlight ; and [I]0-i heard [him]84-borset fall over the scraper , which made [me]0-i feel glad [I]0-i had n't removed it . When [he]84-borset had gone , [I]0-i thought of a splendid answer [I]0-i ought to have given [him]84-borset . However , [I]0-i will keep it for another occasion .

April 7.-Being Saturday , [I]0-i looked forward to being [home]287-home early , and putting a few things straight ; but [two of [[our]321-we principals at [the office]323-the office]322-our principals at the office]320-two of our principals at the office were absent through illness , and [I]0-i did not get [home]287-home till seven . Found [Borset]84-borset waiting . [He]84-borset had been three times during the day to apologise for [his]84-borset conduct last night . [He]84-borset said [he]84-borset was unable to take [his]84-borset Bank Holiday last Monday , and took it last night instead . [He]84-borset begged [me]0-i to accept [his]84-borset apology , and a pound of fresh butter . [He]84-borset seems , after all , [a decent sort of fellow]325-a decent sort of fellow ; so [I]0-i gave [him]84-borset an order for some fresh eggs , with a request that on this occasion they should be fresh . [I]0-i am afraid [we]321-we shall have to get some new stair - carpets after all ; [our]321-we old ones are not quite wide enough to meet the paint on either side . [Carrie]73-carrie suggests that [we]321-we might [ourselves]321-we broaden the paint . [I]0-i will see if [we]321-we can match the colour ( dark chocolate ) on Monday . April 8 , [Sunday.-After Church]4-sunday.-after church , [the Curate]326-the curate came back with [us]321-we . [I]0-i sent [Carrie]73-carrie in to open front door , which [we]321-we do not use except on special occasions . [She]73-carrie could not get it open , and after all [my]0-i display , [I]0-i had to take [the Curate]326-the curate ( whose name , by - the - by , [I]0-i did not catch ) round the side entrance . [He]326-the curate caught [his]326-the curate foot in the scraper , and tore the bottom of [his]326-the curate trousers . Most annoying , as [Carrie]73-carrie could not well offer to repair them on a Sunday . After dinner , went to sleep . Took a walk round [the garden]328-the garden , and discovered a beautiful spot for sowing mustard - and - cress and radishes . Went to [Church]329-church again in the evening : walked back with [the Curate]326-the curate . [Carrie]73-carrie noticed [he]326-the curate had got on the same pair of trousers , only repaired . [He]326-the curate wants [me]0-i to take round the plate , which [I]0-i think a great compliment . [Tradesmen]273-tradesmen and the scraper still troublesome . [Gowing]76-gowing rather tiresome with [his]76-gowing complaints of the paint . [I]0-i make one of the best jokes of [my]0-i life . Delights of gardening . [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook , [Gowing]76-gowing , [Cummings]75-cummings , and [I]0-i have a little misunder­standing . [Sarah]85-sarah makes [me]0-i look [a fool]332-a fool before [Cummings]75-cummings . April 9 - Commenced the morning badly . [The butcher]333-the butcher , whom [we]334-we decided not to arrange with , called and blackguarded [me]0-i in the most uncalled - for manner . [He]333-the butcher began by abusing [me]0-i , and saying [he]333-the butcher did not want [my]0-i custom . [I]0-i simply said : " Then what are [you]333-the butcher making all this fuss about it for ? "[0-i] And [he]333-the butcher shouted out at the top of [his]333-the butcher voice , so that all [the neighbours]335-the neighbours could hear : " [Pah]1427-pah ! go along . Ugh ! [I]333-the butcher could buy up ' things ' like [you]0-i by the dozen ! "[333-the butcher] [I]0-i shut the door , and was giving [Carrie]73-carrie to understand that this disgraceful scene was entirely [her]73-carrie fault , when there was a violent kicking at the door , enough to break the panels . [It]336-it was [the blackguard butcher]337-the blackguard butcher again , who said [he]337-the blackguard butcher had cut [his]337-the blackguard butcher foot over the scraper , and would immediately bring an action against [me]0-i . Called at [Farmerson 's]80-farmerson , [the ironmonger]298-the ironmonger , on [my]0-i way to [town]339-town , and gave [him]333-the butcher the job of moving the scraper and repairing the bells , thinking it scarcely worth while to trouble [the landlord]285-the landlord with such a trifling matter . Arrived [home]287-home tired and worried . [Mr. Putley]87-putley , [a painter and decorator , who had sent in a card]342-a painter and decorator , who had sent in a card , said [he]87-putley could not match the colour on the stairs , as it contained Indian carmine . [He]87-putley said [he]87-putley spent half - a - day calling at [warehouses]343-warehouses to see if [he]87-putley could get it . [He]87-putley suggested [he]87-putley should entirely re - paint the stairs . It would cost very little more ; and if [he]87-putley tried to match it , [he]87-putley could only make a bad job of it . It would be more satisfactory to [him]87-putley and to [us]344-us to have the work done properly . [I]0-i consented , but felt [I]0-i had been talked over . Planted some mustard - and - cress and radishes , and went to bed at nine . [April 10.-Farmerson]83-april came round to attend to [the scraper]274-the scraper [himself]87-putley . [He]87-putley seems [a very civil fellow]346-a very civil fellow . [He]87-putley says [he]87-putley does not usually conduct such small jobs personally , but for [me]0-i [he]87-putley would do so . [I]0-i thanked [him]87-putley , and went to [town]339-town . It is disgraceful how late [some of [the young clerks]349-the young clerks]348-some of the young clerks are at arriving . [I]0-i told three of [them]348-some of the young clerks that if [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , [the principal]350-the principal , heard of it , [they]348-some of the young clerks might be discharged . [Pitt]89-pitt , [a monkey of seventeen]351-a monkey of seventeen , who has only been with [us]352-us six weeks , told [me]0-i " to keep [my]0-i hair on ! "[0-i] [I]0-i informed [him]89-pitt [I]0-i had had the honour of being in the firm twenty years , to which [he]89-pitt insolently replied that [I]0-i " looked it . "[0-i] [I]0-i gave [him]89-pitt an indignant look , and said : " [I]0-i demand from [you]89-pitt some respect , [sir]1428-sir . "[0-i] [He]89-pitt replied : " All right , go on demanding . "[89-pitt] [I]0-i would not argue with [him]89-pitt any further . [You]353-you can not argue with [people like that]354-people like that . In the evening [Gowing]76-gowing called , and repeated [his]76-gowing complaint about the smell of paint . [Gowing]76-gowing is sometimes very tedious with [his]76-gowing remarks , and not always cautious ; and [Carrie]73-carrie once very properly reminded [him]76-gowing that [she]73-carrie was present . [April 11.-Mustard - and - cress and radishes]83-april not come up yet . To - day was a day of annoyances . [I]0-i missed [the quarter - to - nine ' bus to [the City]286-the city]355-the quarter - to - nine ' bus to the city , through having words with [[the grocer]357-the grocer 's boy]358-the grocer 's boy , who for the second time had the impertinence to bring [his]358-the grocer 's boy basket to the hall - door , and had left the marks of [his]358-the grocer 's boy dirty boots on the fresh - cleaned door - steps . [He]358-the grocer 's boy said [he]358-the grocer 's boy had knocked at the side - door with [his]358-the grocer 's boy knuckles for a quarter of an hour . [I]0-i knew [Sarah]85-sarah , [[our]359-our servant]360-our servant , could not hear this , as [she]85-sarah was [upstairs]361-upstairs doing [the bedrooms]362-the bedrooms , so asked [the boy]363-the boy why [he]363-the boy did not ring the bell ? [He]363-the boy replied that [he]363-the boy did pull the bell , but the handle came off in [his]363-the boy hand . [I]0-i was half - an - hour late at [the office]323-the office , a thing that has never happened to [me]0-i before . There has recently been much irregularity in the attendance of [the clerks]365-the clerks , and [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , [[our]359-our principal]366-our principal , unfortunately chose this very morning to pounce down upon [us]359-our early . [Someone]311-someone had given the tip to [the others]368-the others . The result was that [I]0-i was [the only one late of [the lot]370-the lot]369-the only one late of the lot . [Buckling]90-buckling , [one of [the senior clerks]372-the senior clerks]371-one of the senior clerks , was a brick , and [I]0-i was saved by [his]90-buckling intervention . As [I]0-i passed by [Pitt]89-pitt 's desk , [I]0-i heard [him]90-buckling remark to [[his]90-buckling neighbour]373-his neighbour : " How disgracefully late [some of [the head clerks]1430-the head clerks]1429-some of the head clerks arrive ? "[90-buckling] This was , of course , meant for [me]0-i . [I]0-i treated the observation with silence , simply giving [him]90-buckling a look , which unfortunately had the effect of making [both of [the clerks]365-the clerks]374-both of the clerks laugh . Thought afterwards it would have been more dignified if [I]0-i had pretended not to have heard [him]90-buckling at all . [Cummings]75-cummings called in the evening , and [we]376-we played dominoes . [April 12.-Mustard - and - cress and radishes]377-april 12.-mustard - and - cress and radishes not come up yet . Left [Farmerson]80-farmerson repairing the scraper , but when [I]0-i came [home]287-home found [three men]379-three men working . [I]0-i asked the meaning of it , and [Farmerson]80-farmerson said that in making a fresh hole [he]80-farmerson had penetrated the gas - pipe . [He]80-farmerson said it was a most ridiculous place to put the gas - pipe , and [the man who did it]380-the man who did it evidently knew nothing about [his]80-farmerson business . [I]0-i felt [his]80-farmerson excuse was no consolation for the expense [I]0-i shall be put to . In the evening , after tea , [Gowing]76-gowing dropped in , and [we]376-we had a smoke together in [the breakfast - parlour]381-the breakfast - parlour . [Carrie]73-carrie joined [us]376-we later , but did not stay long , saying the smoke was too much for [her]73-carrie . It was also rather too much for [me]0-i ; for [Gowing]76-gowing had given [me]0-i what [he]76-gowing called a green cigar , one that [[his]76-gowing friend]382-his friend [Shoemach]91-shoemach had just brought over from [America]6-america . The cigar did n't look green , but [I]0-i fancy [I]0-i must have done so ; for when [I]0-i had smoked a little more than half , [I]0-i was obliged to retire on the pretext of telling [Sarah]85-sarah to bring in the glasses . [I]0-i took a walk round [the garden]328-the garden three or four times , feeling the need of fresh air . On returning [Gowing]76-gowing noticed [I]0-i was not smoking : offered [me]0-i another cigar , which [I]0-i politely declined . [Gowing]76-gowing began [his]76-gowing usual sniffing , so , anticipating [him]76-gowing , [I]0-i said : " [You]76-gowing 're not going to complain of the smell of paint again ? "[0-i] [He]76-gowing said : " No , not this time ; but [I]76-gowing 'll tell [you]0-i what , [I]76-gowing distinctly smell dry rot . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i do n't often make jokes , but [I]0-i replied : " [You]76-gowing 're talking a lot of dry rot [yourself]76-gowing . "[0-i] [I]0-i could not help roaring at this , and [Carrie]73-carrie said [her]73-carrie sides quite ached with laughter . [I]0-i never was so immensely tickled by anything [I]0-i have ever said before . [I]0-i actually woke up twice during the night , and laughed till the bed shook . [April]83-april 13.-An extraordinary coincidence : [Carry]73-carrie had called in [a woman]384-a woman to make some chintz covers for [our]385-our drawing - room chairs and sofa to prevent the sun fading the green rep of the furniture . [I]0-i saw [the woman]386-the woman , and recognised [her]386-the woman as [a woman who used to work years ago for [[my]0-i old aunt at [Clapham]7-clapham]388-my old aunt at clapham]387-a woman who used to work years ago for my old aunt at clapham . It only shows how small [the world]389-the world is .

April 14.-Spent the whole of the afternoon in [the garden]328-the garden , having this morning picked up at a bookstall for fivepence a capital little book , in good condition , on Gardening . [I]0-i procured and sowed some half - hardy annuals in what [I]0-i fancy will be a warm , sunny border . [I]0-i thought of a joke , and called out [Carrie]73-carrie . [Carrie]73-carrie came out rather testy , [I]0-i thought . [I]0-i said : " [I]0-i have just discovered [we]1431-we have got [a lodging - house]1432-a lodging - house . "[0-i] [She]73-carrie replied : " How do [you]0-i mean ? "[73-carrie] [I]0-i said : " Look at [the boarders]1433-the boarders . "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie said : " Is that all [you]0-i wanted [me]73-carrie for ? "[73-carrie] [I]0-i said : " Any other time [you]73-carrie would have laughed at [my]0-i little pleasantry . "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie said : " Certainly - at any other time , but not when [I]73-carrie am busy in [the house]318-the house . "[73-carrie] [The stairs]391-the stairs looked very nice . [Gowing]76-gowing called , and said the stairs looked all right , but it made the banisters look all wrong , and suggested a coat of paint on them also , which [Carrie]73-carrie quite agreed with . [I]0-i walked round to [Putley]87-putley , and fortunately [he]76-gowing was out ; so [I]0-i had a good excuse to let the banisters slide . By - the - by , that is rather funny .

April 15 , Sunday.-At three o'clock [Cummings]75-cummings and [Gowing]76-gowing called for a good long walk over [Hampstead]8-hampstead and [Finchley]9-finchley , and brought with [them]392-them [a friend named [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook]393-a friend named stillbrook . [We]394-we walked and chatted together , except [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook , who was always a few yards behind [us]394-we staring at the ground and cutting at the grass with [his]86-mr. stillbrook stick .

As it was getting on for five , [we]394-we four held a consultation , and [Gowing]76-gowing suggested that [we]394-we should make for " [The Cow and Hedge]1435-the cow and hedge "[86-mr. stillbrook] and get some tea . [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook said : " A brandy - and - soda was good enough for [him]393-a friend named stillbrook . "[86-mr. stillbrook] [I]0-i reminded [them]392-them that [all public - houses]395-all public - houses were closed till six o'clock . [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook said : " That 's all right - bonâ fide [travellers]1436-travellers . "[86-mr. stillbrook] [We]394-we arrived ; and as [I]0-i was trying to pass , [the man in charge of the gate]396-the man in charge of the gate said : " Where from ? "[0-i] [I]0-i replied : " [Holloway]2-holloway . "[0-i] [He]86-mr. stillbrook immediately put up [his]86-mr. stillbrook arm , and declined to let [me]0-i pass . [I]0-i turned back for a moment , when [I]0-i saw [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook , closely followed by [Cummings]75-cummings and [Gowing]76-gowing , make for the entrance . [I]0-i watched [them]392-them , and thought [I]0-i would have a good laugh at [their]392-them expense . [I]0-i heard [the porter]397-the porter say : " Where from ? "[397-the porter] When , to [my]0-i surprise , in fact disgust , [Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook replied : " [Blackheath]10-blackheath , "[86-mr. stillbrook] and [the three]398-the three were immediately admitted .

[Gowing]76-gowing called to [me]0-i across the gate , and said : " [We]398-the three sha n't be a minute . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i waited for [them]398-the three the best part of an hour . When [they]398-the three appeared [they]398-the three were all in most excellent spirits , and [the only one who made an effort to apologise]399-the only one who made an effort to apologise was [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook , who said to [me]0-i : " It was very rough on [you]0-i to be kept waiting , but [we]398-the three had another spin for S. and B. 's . "[86-mr. stillbrook] [I]0-i walked [home]287-home in silence ; [I]0-i could n't speak to [them]398-the three . [I]0-i felt very dull all the evening , but deemed it advisable not to say anything to [Carrie]73-carrie about the matter . [April]83-april 16.-After business , set to work in [the garden]328-the garden . When it got dark [I]0-i wrote to [Cummings]75-cummings and [Gowing]76-gowing ( who neither called , for a wonder ; perhaps [they]398-the three were ashamed of [themselves]398-the three ) about yesterday 's adventure at " [The Cow and Hedge]1435-the cow and hedge . "[76-gowing] Afterwards made up [my]0-i mind not to write yet . April 17.-Thought [I]0-i would write a kind little note to [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings about last Sunday , and warning [them]398-the three against [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook . Afterwards , thinking the matter over , tore up the letters , and determined not to write at all , but to speak quietly to [them]398-the three . Dumbfounded at receiving a sharp letter from [Cummings]75-cummings , saying that both [he]86-mr. stillbrook and [Gowing]76-gowing had been waiting for an explanation of [my]0-i ( mind [you]402-you , [MY]0-i ) extraordinary conduct coming [home]287-home on Sunday . At last [I]0-i wrote : " [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was [the aggrieved party]1438-the aggrieved party ; but as [I]0-i freely forgive [you]402-you , [you]402-you - feeling [yourself]402-you aggrieved - should bestow forgiveness on [me]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i have copied this verbatim in the diary , because [I]0-i think it is one of the most perfect and thoughtful sentences [I]0-i have ever written . [I]0-i posted the letter , but in [my]0-i own heart [I]0-i felt [I]0-i was actually apologising for having been insulted . [April]83-april 18.-Am in for a cold . Spent the whole day at [the office]323-the office sneezing . In the evening , the cold being intolerable , sent [Sarah]85-sarah out for a bottle of Kinahan . Fell asleep in the arm - chair , and woke with the shivers . Was startled by a loud knock at the front - door . [Carrie]73-carrie awfully flurried . [Sarah]85-sarah still out , so went up , opened the door , and found it was only [Cummings]75-cummings . [Remembered]92-remembered [[the grocer]357-the grocer 's boy]358-the grocer 's boy had again broken the side - bell . [Cummings]75-cummings squeezed [my]0-i hand , and said : " [I]75-cummings 've just seen [Gowing]76-gowing . All right . Say no more about it . "[75-cummings] There is no doubt [they]407-they are both under the impression [I]0-i have apologised . While playing dominoes with [Cummings]75-cummings in [the parlour]408-the parlour , [he]357-the grocer said : " By - the - by , do [you]0-i want any wine or spirits ? [[My]357-the grocer cousin]1439-my cousin [Merton]93-merton has just set up in the trade , and has a splendid whisky , four years in bottle , at thirty - eight shillings . It is worth [your]0-i while laying down a few dozen of it . "[357-the grocer] [I]0-i told [him]357-the grocer [[my]0-i cellars]409-my cellars , which were very small , were full up . "[85-sarah]

A conversation with [Mr. Merton]93-merton on Society . [Mr.]412-mr. and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , of [Sutton]12-sutton , come up . A miserable evening at [the Tank Theatre]413-the tank theatre . Experiments with enamel paint . [I]0-i make another good joke ; but [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings are unnecessarily offended . [I]0-i paint the bath red , with unexpected result . April 19 - [Cummings]75-cummings called , bringing with [him]93-merton [[his]93-merton friend]382-his friend [Merton]93-merton , who is in the wine trade . [Gowing]76-gowing also called . [Mr. Merton]93-merton made [himself]93-merton at [home]287-home at once , and [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i were both struck with [him]93-merton immediately , and thoroughly approved of [his]93-merton sentiments . [He]93-merton leaned back in [his]93-merton chair and said : " [You]0-i must take [me]93-merton as [I]93-merton am ; "[93-merton] and [I]0-i replied : " Yes - and [you]76-gowing must take [us]1442-we as [we]1442-we are . [We]1442-we 're [homely people]1443-homely people , [we]1442-we are not swells . "[0-i] [He]93-merton answered : " No , [I]93-merton can see that , "[93-merton] and [Gowing]76-gowing roared with laughter ; but [Merton]93-merton in a most gentlemanly manner said to [Gowing]76-gowing , " [I]93-merton do n't think [you]76-gowing quite understand [me]93-merton . [I]93-merton intended to convey that [[our]1442-we charming host]1444-our charming host and [hostess]1445-hostess were superior to the follies of fashion , and preferred leading a simple and wholesome life to gadding about to twopenny - halfpenny tea - drinking afternoons , and living above [their]293-friends incomes . "[93-merton] [I]0-i was immensely pleased with these sensible remarks of [Merton]93-merton 's , and concluded that subject by saying : " No , candidly , [Mr. Merton]93-merton , [we]1442-we do n't go into Society , because [we]1442-we do not care for it ; and what with the expense of [cabs]1446-cabs here and [cabs there]1447-cabs there , and white gloves and white ties , & c. , it does n't seem worth the money . "[93-merton] [Merton]93-merton said in reference to [friends]293-friends , " [My]76-gowing motto is ' Few and True ; ' and , by the way , [I]76-gowing also apply that to wine , ' Little and Good . ' "[76-gowing] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Yes , and sometimes ' cheap and tasty , ' eh , [old man]1448-old man ? "[76-gowing] [Merton]93-merton still continuing , said [he]93-merton should treat [me]0-i as [a friend]417-a friend , and put [me]0-i down for a dozen of [his]93-merton " Lockanbar "[93-merton] whisky , and as [I]0-i was [an old friend of [Gowing]76-gowing]418-an old friend of gowing , [I]0-i should have it for 36s . , which was considerably under what [he]93-merton paid for it . [He]93-merton booked [his]93-merton own order , and further said that at any time [I]0-i wanted any passes for [the theatre]419-the theatre [I]0-i was to let [him]93-merton know , as [his]93-merton name stood good for [any theatre in [London]13-london]420-any theatre in london . [April]83-april 20.-Carrie reminded [me]0-i that as [[her]421-her old school friend]422-her old school friend , [Annie Fullers]95-annie fullers ( now [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james ) , and [[her]421-her husband]423-her husband had come up from [Sutton]12-sutton for a few days , it would look kind to take [them]424-them to [the theatre]419-the theatre , and would [I]0-i drop a line to [Mr. Merton]93-merton asking [him]93-merton for passes for four , either for [the Italian Opera]426-the italian opera , [Haymarket , Savoy]14-haymarket , savoy , or Lyceum . April 23.-Mr . and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james ( [Miss Fullers]96-miss fullers that was ) , came to meat tea , and [we]430-we left directly after for [the Tank Theatre]413-the tank theatre . "[435-the man] While [I]0-i was having some very unpleasant words with [the man]435-the man , [James]94-mrs. james , who had gone [upstairs]361-upstairs with [the ladies]439-the ladies , called out : " Come on ! [Mr. James]97-mr. james , of [Sutton]12-sutton , was very good . [He]97-mr. james said : " Do n't worry - [no one]1450-no one will notice it with [your]0-i beard . [April 24.-Could]83-april scarcely sleep a wink through thinking of having brought up [Mr.]442-mr. and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james from [the country]443-the country to go to [the theatre]419-the theatre last night , and [his]97-mr. james having paid for a private box because [our]445-our order was not honoured ; and such a poor play too . [I]0-i wrote a very satirical letter to [Merton]93-merton , [the wine merchant , who gave [us]445-our]446-the wine merchant , who gave us the pass , and said , " Considering [we]445-our had to pay for [our]445-our seats , [we]445-our did [our]445-our best to appreciate the performance . "[73-carrie] April 25.-In consequence of [Brickwell]100-brickwell telling [me]0-i [[his]100-brickwell wife]447-his wife was working wonders with the new [Pinkford]101-pinkford 's enamel paint , [I]0-i determined to try it . [I]0-i bought two tins of red on [my]0-i way [home]287-home . [I]0-i hastened through tea , went into [the garden]328-the garden and painted some flower - pots . [I]0-i called out [Carrie]73-carrie , who said : " [You]0-i 've always got some new - fangled craze ; "[73-carrie] but [she]73-carrie was obliged to admit that the flower - pots looked remarkably well . Went [upstairs]361-upstairs into [[the servant]281-the servant 's bedroom]300-the servant 's bedroom and painted [her]281-the servant washstand , towel - horse , and chest of drawers . To [my]0-i mind it was an extraordinary improvement , but as an example of the ignorance of [the lower classes]453-the lower classes in the matter of taste , [[our]454-we servant]360-our servant [Sarah]85-sarah , on seeing [them]456-them , evinced no sign of pleasure , but merely said : " [she]85-sarah thought they looked very well as they was before . "[85-sarah]

April 26.-Got some more red enamel paint ( red , to [my]0-i mind , being the best colour ) , and painted the coal - scuttle , and the backs of [our]454-we Shakspeare , the binding of which had almost worn out . [April]83-april 27.-Painted the bath red , and was delighted with the result . Sorry to say [Carrie]73-carrie was not , in fact [we]454-we had a few words about it . [She]73-carrie said [I]0-i ought to have consulted [her]73-carrie , and [she]73-carrie had never heard of such a thing as a bath being painted red . [I]0-i replied : " It 's merely a matter of taste . "[0-i] Fortunately , further argument on the subject was stopped by a voice saying , " May [I]75-cummings come in ? "[75-cummings] It was only [Cummings]75-cummings , who said , " [[Your]0-i maid]1452-your maid opened the door , and asked [me]75-cummings to excuse [her]1452-your maid showing [me]75-cummings in , as [she]1452-your maid was wringing out some socks . "[75-cummings] [I]0-i was delighted to see [him]457-he , and suggested [we]454-we should have a game of whist with [a dummy]458-a dummy , and by way of merriment said : " [You]0-i can be the dummy . "[457-he] [Cummings]75-cummings ( [I]0-i thought rather ill - naturedly ) replied : " Funny as usual . "[75-cummings] [He]457-he said [he]457-he could n't stop , [he]457-he only called to leave [me]0-i the Bicycle News , as [he]457-he had done with it . Another ring at the bell ; it was [Gowing]76-gowing , who said " [he]76-gowing must apologise for coming so often , and that one of these days [we]454-we must come round to [him]76-gowing . "[0-i] [I]0-i said : " A very extraordinary thing has struck [me]0-i . "[0-i] " Something funny , as usual , "[75-cummings] said [Cummings]75-cummings . " Yes , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied ; " [I]0-i think even [you]75-cummings will say so this time . It 's concerning [you]75-cummings both ; for does n't it seem odd that [Gowing]76-gowing 's always coming , and [Cumming]102-cumming 's always going ? "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie , who had evidently quite forgotten about the bath , went into fits of laughter , and as for [myself]0-i , [I]0-i fairly doubled up in [my]0-i chair , till it cracked beneath [me]0-i . [I]0-i think this was one of the best jokes [I]0-i have ever made . Then imagine [my]0-i astonishment on perceiving both [Cummings]75-cummings and [Gowing]76-gowing perfectly silent , and without a smile on [their]459-their faces . After rather an unpleasant pause , [Cummings]75-cummings , who had opened a cigar - case , closed it up again and said : " Yes - [I]75-cummings think , after that , [I]75-cummings shall be going , and [I]75-cummings am sorry [I]75-cummings fail to see the fun of [your]75-cummings jokes . "[75-cummings] [Gowing]76-gowing said [he]76-gowing did n't mind a joke when it was n't rude , but a pun on a name , to [his]76-gowing thinking , was certainly a little wanting in good taste . [Cummings]75-cummings followed it up by saying , if it had been said by [any one else]460-any one else but [myself]0-i , [he]76-gowing should n't have entered [the house]318-the house again . This rather unpleasantly terminated what might have been a cheerful evening . However , it was as well [they]459-their went , for [the charwoman]462-the charwoman had finished up the remains of the cold pork . [April]83-april 28.-At [the office]323-the office , [the new and very young clerk [Pitt]89-pitt , who was very impudent to [me]0-i a week or so ago]464-the new and very young clerk pitt , who was very impudent to me a week or so ago , was late again . [I]0-i told [him]89-pitt it would be [my]0-i duty to inform [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , [the principal]350-the principal . To [my]0-i surprise [Pitt]89-pitt apologised most humbly and in a most gentlemanly fashion . [I]0-i was unfeignedly pleased to notice this improvement in [his]89-pitt manner towards [me]0-i , and told [him]89-pitt [I]0-i would look over [his]89-pitt unpunctuality . Passing down [the room]410-the room an hour later , [I]0-i received a smart smack in the face from a rolled - up ball of hard foolscap . [I]0-i turned round sharply , but [all the clerks]467-all the clerks were apparently riveted to [their]467-all the clerks work . [I]0-i am not [a rich man]468-a rich man , but [I]0-i would give half - a - sovereign to know whether that was thrown by accident or design . Went [home]287-home early and bought some more enamel paint - black this time - and spent the evening touching up the fender , picture - frames , and an old pair of boots , making them look as good as new . Also painted [Gowing]76-gowing 's walking - stick , which [he]76-gowing left behind , and made it look like ebony . April 29 , Sunday.-Woke up with a fearful headache and strong symptoms of a cold . [Carrie]73-carrie , with a perversity which is just like [her]73-carrie , said it was " [painter]1453-painter 's colic , "[73-carrie] and was the result of [my]0-i having spent the last few days with [my]0-i nose over a paint - pot . [I]0-i told [her]73-carrie firmly that [I]0-i knew a great deal better what was the matter with [me]0-i than [she]73-carrie did . [I]0-i had got a chill , and decided to have a bath as hot as [I]0-i could bear it . Bath ready - could scarcely bear it so hot . [I]0-i persevered , and got in ; very hot , but very acceptable . [I]0-i lay still for some time .

On moving [my]0-i hand above the surface of the water , [I]0-i experienced the greatest fright [I]0-i ever received in the whole course of [my]0-i life ; for imagine [my]0-i horror on discovering [my]0-i hand , as [I]0-i thought , full of blood . [My]0-i first thought was that [I]0-i had ruptured an artery , and was bleeding to death , and should be discovered , later on , looking like [a second Marat]470-a second marat , as [I]0-i remember seeing [him]470-a second marat in [Madame Tussaud]103-madame tussaud 's . [My]0-i second thought was to ring the bell , but remembered there was no bell to ring . [My]0-i third was , that there was nothing but the enamel paint , which had dissolved with boiling water . [I]0-i stepped out of [the bath]471-the bath , perfectly red all over , resembling the Red Indians [I]0-i have seen depicted at [an East - End theatre]472-an east - end theatre . [I]0-i determined not to say a word to [Carrie]73-carrie , but to tell [Farmerson]80-farmerson to come on Monday and paint the bath white . The Ball at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house . April 30 - Perfectly astounded at receiving an invitation for [Carrie]73-carrie and [myself]0-i from [the Lord and Lady Mayoress]474-the lord and lady mayoress to [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house , to " meet [the Represen­tatives of Trades and Commerce]1454-the represen­tatives of trades and commerce . "[0-i] [My]0-i heart beat like that of [a schoolboy]476-a schoolboy 's . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i read the invitation over two or three times . [I]0-i could scarcely eat [my]0-i breakfast . [I]0-i said - and [I]0-i felt it from the bottom of [my]0-i heart,-"Carrie darling , [I]0-i was [a proud man]1455-a proud man when [I]0-i led [you]73-carrie down the aisle of [the church]1456-the church on [our]1457-our wedding - day ; that pride will be equalled , if not surpassed , when [I]0-i lead [[my]0-i dear , pretty wife]1458-my dear , pretty wife up to the Lord and [Lady Mayoress]1459-lady mayoress at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house . "[0-i] [I]0-i saw the tears in [Carrie]73-carrie 's eyes , and [she]73-carrie said : " [[Charlie]104-mrs. pooter dear]1461-charlie dear , it is [I]73-carrie who have to be proud of [you]104-mrs. pooter . And [I]73-carrie am very , very proud of [you]104-mrs. pooter . [You]104-mrs. pooter have called [me]73-carrie pretty ; and as long as [I]73-carrie am pretty in [your]104-mrs. pooter eyes , [I]73-carrie am happy . [You]104-mrs. pooter , [dear old Charlie]104-mrs. pooter , are not handsome , but [you]104-mrs. pooter are good , which is far more noble . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i gave [her]73-carrie a kiss , and [she]73-carrie said : " [I]73-carrie wonder if there will be any dancing ? [I]73-carrie have not danced with [you]104-mrs. pooter for years . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i can not tell what induced [me]0-i to do it , but [I]0-i seized [her]73-carrie round the waist , and [we]477-we were silly enough to be executing a wild kind of polka when [Sarah]85-sarah entered , grinning , and said : " There is [a man]1462-a man , [mum]1463-mum , at the door who wants to know if [you]104-mrs. pooter want any good coals . "[85-sarah] [Most]105-most annoyed at this . Spent the evening in answering , and tearing up again , the reply to [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house , having left word with [Sarah]85-sarah if [Gowing]76-gowing or [Cummings]75-cummings called [we]477-we were not at [home]287-home . Must consult [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp how to answer [the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor 's invitation . May 1.-Carrie said : " [I]0-i should like to send [mother]1464-mother the invitation to look at . "[0-i] [I]0-i consented , as soon as [I]0-i had answered it . [I]0-i told [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , at [the office]323-the office , with a feeling of pride , that [we]477-we had received an invitation to [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house ; and [he]88-mr. perkupp said , to [my]0-i astonishment , that [he]88-mr. perkupp [himself]88-mr. perkupp gave in [my]0-i name to [[the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor 's secretary]484-the lord mayor 's secretary . [I]0-i felt this rather discounted the value of the invitation , but [I]0-i thanked [him]88-mr. perkupp ; and in reply to [me]0-i , [he]88-mr. perkupp described how [I]0-i was to answer it . [I]0-i felt the reply was too simple ; but of course [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp knows best .

May 2.-Sent [my]0-i dress - coat and trousers to [the little tailor]485-the little tailor 's round the corner , to have the creases taken out . Told [Gowing]76-gowing not to call next Monday , as [we]477-we were going to [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house . Sent similar note to [Cummings]75-cummings . May 3.-Carrie went to [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , at [Sutton]12-sutton , to consult about [her]94-mrs. james dress for next Monday . While speaking incidentally to [Spotch]106-spotch , [one of [[our]477-we head clerks]488-our head clerks]487-one of our head clerks , about [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house , [he]106-spotch said : " Oh , [I]106-spotch 'm asked , but do n't think [I]106-spotch shall go . "[106-spotch] When [a vulgar man]490-a vulgar man like [Spotch]106-spotch is asked , [I]0-i feel [my]0-i invitation is considerably discounted . In the evening , while [I]0-i was out , [the little tailor]485-the little tailor brought round [my]0-i coat and trousers , and because [Sarah]85-sarah had not a shilling to pay for the pressing , [he]485-the little tailor took them away again . [[May 4.-Carrie]492-may 4.-carrie 's [mother]1464-mother]493-may 4.-carrie 's mother returned the [Lord Mayor]107-lord mayor 's invitation , which was sent to [her]1464-mother to look at , with apologies for having upset a glass of port over it . [I]0-i was too angry to say anything . May 5.-Bought a pair of lavender kid - gloves for next Monday , and two white ties , in case one got spoiled in the tying . May 6 , Sunday.-A very dull sermon , during which , [I]0-i regret to say , [I]0-i twice thought of [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house reception to - morrow . May 7.-A big red - letter day ; viz . , [the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor 's reception . [The whole house]497-the whole house upset . [I]0-i had to get dressed at half - past six , as [Carrie]73-carrie wanted [the room]410-the room to [herself]73-carrie . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james had come up from [Sutton]12-sutton to help [Carrie]73-carrie ; so [I]0-i could not help thinking it unreasonable that [she]73-carrie should require the entire attention of [Sarah]85-sarah , [the servant]281-the servant , as well . [Sarah]85-sarah kept running out of [the house]318-the house to fetch " something for [missis]1465-missis , "[85-sarah] and several times [I]0-i had , in [my]0-i full evening - dress , to answer the back - door . The last time it was [[the greengrocer]501-the greengrocer 's boy]502-the greengrocer 's boy , who , not seeing it was [me]0-i , for [Sarah]85-sarah had not lighted the gas , pushed into [my]0-i hands two cabbages and half - a - dozen coal - blocks . [I]0-i indignantly threw them on the ground , and felt so annoyed that [I]0-i so far forgot [myself]0-i as to box [the boy]363-the boy 's ears . [He]363-the boy went away crying , and said [he]363-the boy should summons [me]0-i , a thing [I]0-i would not have happen for [the world]389-the world . In the dark , [I]0-i stepped on a piece of the cabbage , which brought [me]0-i down on the flags all of a heap . For a moment [I]0-i was stunned , but when [I]0-i recovered [I]0-i crawled [upstairs]361-upstairs into [the drawing - room]506-the drawing - room , and on looking into the chimney - glass discovered that [my]0-i chin was bleeding , [my]0-i shirt smeared with the coal - blocks , and [my]0-i left trouser torn at the knee .

However , [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james brought [me]0-i down another shirt , which [I]0-i changed in [the drawing - room]506-the drawing - room . [I]0-i put a piece of court - plaister on [my]0-i chin , and [Sarah]85-sarah very neatly sewed up the tear at the knee . At nine o'clock [Carrie]73-carrie swept into [the room]410-the room , looking like [a queen]509-a queen . Never have [I]0-i seen [her]73-carrie look so lovely , or so distinguished . [She]73-carrie was wearing a satin dress of sky - blue - [my]0-i favourite colour - and a piece of lace , which [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james lent [her]73-carrie , round the shoulders , to give a finish . [I]0-i thought perhaps the dress was a little too long behind , and decidedly too short in front , but [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said it was à la mode . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james was most kind , and lent [Carrie]73-carrie a fan of ivory with red feathers , the value of which , [she]94-mrs. james said , was priceless , as the feathers belonged to the Kachu eagle - a bird now extinct . [I]0-i preferred the little white fan which [Carrie]73-carrie bought for three - and - six at [Shoolbred 's]21-shoolbred 's , but [both ladies]510-both ladies sat on [me]0-i at once . [We]511-we arrived at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house too early , which was rather fortunate , for [I]0-i had an opportunity of speaking to [[his]513-his lordship]514-his lordship , who graciously condescended to talk with [me]0-i some minutes ; but [I]0-i must say [I]0-i was disappointed to find [he]514-his lordship did not even know [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , [[our]511-we principal]366-our principal . [I]0-i felt as if [we]511-we had been invited to [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house by one who did not know [the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor [himself]480-the lord mayor . [Crowds]518-crowds arrived , and [I]0-i shall never forget the grand sight . [My]0-i humble pen can never describe it . [I]0-i was a little annoyed with [Carrie]73-carrie , who kept saying : " Is n't it a pity [we]511-we do n't know [anybody]1466-anybody ? "[73-carrie] Once [she]73-carrie quite lost [her]73-carrie head . [I]0-i saw someone who looked like [Franching]108-franching , from [Peckham]22-peckham , and was moving towards [him]108-franching when [she]73-carrie seized [me]0-i by the coat - tails , and said , quite loudly : " Do n't leave [me]73-carrie , "[73-carrie] which caused [an elderly gentleman]519-an elderly gentleman , in a court - suit , and a chain round [him]108-franching , and [two ladies]520-two ladies , to burst out laughing . There was [an immense crowd]521-an immense crowd in [the supper - room]522-the supper - room , and , [my]0-i stars ! it was a splendid supper - any amount of champagne . [Carrie]73-carrie made a most hearty supper , for which [I]0-i was pleased ; for [I]0-i sometimes think [she]73-carrie is not strong . There was scarcely a dish [she]73-carrie did not taste . [I]0-i was so thirsty , [I]0-i could not eat much . Receiving a sharp slap on the shoulder , [I]0-i turned , and , to [my]0-i amazement , saw [Farmerson]80-farmerson , [[our]523-our ironmonger]524-our ironmonger . [He]80-farmerson said , in the most familiar way : " This is better than [Brickfield Terrace]1-brickfield terrace , eh ? "[80-farmerson] [I]0-i simply looked at [him]80-farmerson , and said coolly : " [I]0-i never expected to see [you]80-farmerson here . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could have thought of something better to say . [He]80-farmerson said : " Can [I]80-farmerson get [[your]0-i good lady]1467-your good lady anything ? "[0-i] [Farmerson]80-farmerson said : " Pardon [me]80-farmerson , [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , no shop when [we]1468-we 're in company , please . "[80-farmerson] Before [I]0-i could think of a reply , [one of [the sheriffs , in full Court costume]526-the sheriffs , in full court costume]525-one of the sheriffs , in full court costume , slapped [Farmerson]80-farmerson on the back and hailed [him]80-farmerson as [an old friend]527-an old friend , and asked [him]80-farmerson to dine with [him]80-farmerson at [[his]80-farmerson lodge]528-his lodge . [We]539-we stood chatting for some time , and at last [I]0-i said : " [You]537-the sheriff must excuse [me]0-i now if [I]0-i join [Mrs. Pooter]104-mrs. pooter . "[0-i] When [I]0-i approached [her]537-the sheriff , [she]537-the sheriff said : " Do n't let [me]537-the sheriff take [you]0-i away from [friends]293-friends . "[537-the sheriff] As it takes two to make a quarrel , and as it was neither the time nor the place for it , [I]0-i gave [my]0-i arm to [Carrie]73-carrie , and said : " [I]0-i hope [[my]0-i darling little wife]1474-my darling little wife will dance with [me]0-i , if only for the sake of saying [we]540-we had danced at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house , as [guests of [the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor]1476-guests of the lord mayor . "[0-i] Finding the dancing after supper was less formal , and knowing how much [Carrie]73-carrie used to admire [my]0-i dancing in the days gone by , [I]0-i put [my]0-i arm round [her]73-carrie waist and [we]540-we commenced a waltz . A most unfortunate accident occurred . [I]0-i had got on a new pair of boots . Foolishly , [I]0-i had omitted to take [Carrie]73-carrie 's advice ; namely , to scratch the soles of them with the points of the scissors or to put a little wet on them . [I]0-i had scarcely started when , like lightning , [my]0-i left foot slipped away and [I]0-i came down , the side of [my]0-i head striking the floor with such violence that for a second or two [I]0-i did not know what had happened . [I]0-i need hardly say that [Carrie]73-carrie fell with [me]0-i with equal violence , breaking the comb in [her]73-carrie hair and grazing [her]73-carrie elbow . There was a roar of laughter , which was immediately checked when [people]541-people found that [we]540-we had really hurt [ourselves]540-we . [A gentleman]317-a gentleman assisted [Carrie]73-carrie to a seat , and [I]0-i expressed [myself]0-i pretty strongly on the danger of having a plain polished floor with no carpet or drugget to prevent [people]541-people slipping . [The gentleman]544-the gentleman , who said [his]544-the gentleman name was [Darwitts]110-darwitts , insisted on escorting [Carrie]73-carrie to have a glass of wine , an invitation which [I]0-i was pleased to allow [Carrie]73-carrie to accept . [I]0-i followed , and met [Farmerson]80-farmerson , who immediately said , in [his]80-farmerson loud voice : " Oh , are [you]0-i [the one who went down]1478-the one who went down ? "[80-farmerson] [I]0-i answered with an indignant look . With execrable taste , [he]80-farmerson said : " Look here , [old man]1448-old man , [we]545-we are too old for this game . [We]545-we must leave these capers to [the youngsters]1480-the youngsters . Come and have another glass , that is more in [our]545-we line . "[80-farmerson] Although [I]0-i felt [I]0-i was buying [his]80-farmerson silence by accepting , [we]545-we followed [the others]368-the others into [the supper - room]522-the supper - room . [Neither Carrie]73-carrie nor [I]0-i , after [our]545-we unfortunate mishap , felt inclined to stay longer . "[80-farmerson] [I]0-i thought it better to consent , but wish [I]0-i had first consulted [Carrie]73-carrie . After [the Mansion House Ball]23-the mansion house ball . [Carrie]73-carrie offended . [Gowing]76-gowing also offended . A pleasant party at [the Cummings ']75-cummings . [Mr. Franching]108-franching , of [Peckham]22-peckham , visits [us]545-we . May 8 - [I]0-i woke up with a most terrible headache . [I]0-i could scarcely see , and the back of [my]0-i neck was as if [I]0-i had given it a crick . [I]0-i thought first of sending for [a doctor]548-a doctor ; but [I]0-i did not think it necessary . When up , [I]0-i felt faint , and went to [Brownish]111-brownish 's , the chemist , who gave [me]0-i a draught . So bad at [the office]323-the office , had to get leave to come [home]287-home . Went to [another chemist in [the City]286-the city]551-another chemist in the city , and [I]0-i got a draught . [Brownish]111-brownish 's dose seems to have made [me]0-i worse ; have eaten nothing all day . To make matters worse , [Carrie]73-carrie , every time [I]0-i spoke to [her]73-carrie , answered [me]0-i sharply - that is , when [she]73-carrie answered at all . In the evening [I]0-i felt very much worse again and said to [her]73-carrie : " [I]73-carrie do believe [I]73-carrie 've been poisoned by the lobster mayonnaise at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house last night ; "[73-carrie] [she]73-carrie simply replied , without taking [her]73-carrie eyes from [her]73-carrie sewing : " [Champagne]112-champagne never did agree with [you]0-i . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i felt irritated , and said : " What nonsense [you]73-carrie talk ; [I]0-i only had a glass and a half , and [you]73-carrie know as well as [I]0-i do-- "[0-i] Before [I]0-i could complete the sentence [she]73-carrie bounced out of [the room]410-the room . [I]0-i sat over an hour waiting for [her]73-carrie to return ; but as [she]73-carrie did not , [I]0-i determined [I]0-i would go to bed . [I]0-i discovered [Carrie]73-carrie had gone to bed without even saying " good - night "[73-carrie] ; leaving [me]0-i to bar the scullery door and feed the cat . [I]0-i shall certainly speak to [her]73-carrie about this in the morning . May 9.-Still a little shaky , with black specs . The Blackfriars Bi - weekly News , contains a long list of [the guests at [the Mansion House ball]23-the mansion house ball]554-the guests at the mansion house ball . Disappointed to find [our]555-our names omitted , though [Farmerson]80-farmerson 's is in plainly enough with [M.L.L.]113-m.l.l. after it , whatever that may mean . More than vexed because [we]555-our had ordered a dozen copies to send to [[our]555-our friends]556-our friends . Wrote to the Blackfriars Bi - weekly News , pointing out [their]556-our friends omission . [Carrie]73-carrie had commenced [her]73-carrie breakfast when [I]0-i entered [the parlour]408-the parlour . [I]0-i helped [myself]0-i to a cup of tea , and [I]0-i said , perfectly calmly and quietly : " [Carrie]73-carrie , [I]0-i wish a little explanation of [your]73-carrie conduct last night . "[0-i] [She]73-carrie replied , " Indeed ! and [I]0-i desire something more than a little explanation of [your]0-i conduct the night before . "[0-i] [I]0-i said , coolly : " Really , [I]0-i do n't understand [you]73-carrie . "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie said sneeringly : " Probably not ; [you]0-i were scarcely in a condition to understand anything . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i was astounded at this insinuation and simply ejaculated : " [Caroline]73-carrie ! "[73-carrie] [She]73-carrie said : " Do n't be theatrical , it has no effect on [me]73-carrie . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i was about to speak , when [Carrie]73-carrie , in a temper such as [I]0-i have never seen [her]73-carrie in before , told [me]0-i to hold [my]0-i tongue . [She]73-carrie said : " Now [I]73-carrie 'm going to say something ! After professing to snub [Mr. Farmerson]80-farmerson , [you]0-i permit [him]80-farmerson to snub [you]0-i , in [my]73-carrie presence , and then accept [his]80-farmerson invitation to take a glass of champagne with [you]0-i , and [you]0-i do n't limit [yourself]0-i to one glass . [You]0-i then offer [this vulgar man]1484-this vulgar man , who made a bungle of repairing [our]1485-our scraper , a seat in [[our]1485-our cab]1486-our cab on the way [home]287-home . [I]73-carrie say nothing about [his]80-farmerson tearing [my]73-carrie dress in getting in [the cab]1488-the cab , nor of treading on [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james 's expensive fan , which [you]0-i knocked out of [my]73-carrie hand , and for which [he]80-farmerson never even apologised ; but [you]0-i smoked all the way [home]287-home without having the decency to ask [my]73-carrie permission . That is not all ! At the end of the journey , although [he]80-farmerson did not offer [you]0-i a farthing towards [his]80-farmerson share of [the cab]1488-the cab , [you]0-i asked [him]80-farmerson in . Fortunately , [he]80-farmerson was sober enough to detect , from [my]73-carrie manner , that [his]80-farmerson company was not desirable . "[73-carrie]

Goodness knows [I]0-i felt humiliated enough at this ; but , to make matters worse , [Gowing]76-gowing entered [the room]410-the room , without knocking , with two hats on [his]76-gowing head and holding the garden - rake in [his]76-gowing hand , with [Carrie]73-carrie 's fur tippet ( which [he]76-gowing had taken off the [downstairs hall]559-downstairs hall - peg ) round [his]76-gowing neck , and announced [himself]76-gowing in a loud , coarse voice : " [[His]80-farmerson Royal Highness]1491-his royal highness , [the Lord Mayor]480-the lord mayor ! "[76-gowing] [He]76-gowing marched twice round [the room]410-the room like [a buffoon]561-a buffoon , and , finding [we]562-we took no notice , said : " Hulloh ! what 's up ? [Lovers]1493-lovers ' quarrel , eh ? "[76-gowing] There was a silence for a moment , so [I]0-i said quietly : " [[My]0-i dear]275-my dear [Gowing]76-gowing , [I]0-i 'm not very well , and not quite in the humour for joking ; especially when [you]76-gowing enter [the room]410-the room without knocking , an act which [I]0-i fail to see the fun of . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " [I]76-gowing 'm very sorry , but [I]76-gowing called for [my]76-gowing stick , which [I]76-gowing thought [you]0-i would have sent round . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i handed [him]76-gowing [his]76-gowing stick , which [I]0-i remembered [I]0-i had painted black with the enamel paint , thinking to improve it . [He]76-gowing looked at it for a minute with a dazed expression and said : " Who did this ? "[76-gowing] [I]0-i said : " Eh ? Did what ? "[0-i] [He]76-gowing said : " Did what ? [I]76-gowing 'll know who did it . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i said : " [I]0-i 'm very sorry . [I]0-i daresay it will come off . [I]0-i did it for the best . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Then all [I]76-gowing can say is , it 's a confounded liberty ; and [I]76-gowing would add , [you]0-i 're a bigger fool than [you]0-i look , only that 's absolutely impossible . "[76-gowing] [May]114-may 12.-Got a single copy of the Blackfriars Bi - weekly News . There was a short list of several names [they]563-they had omitted ; but [the stupid people]564-the stupid people had mentioned [our]565-our names as " [Mr.]1498-mr. and [Mrs. C. Porter]115-mrs. c. porter . "[564-the stupid people] Most annoying ! Wrote again and [I]0-i took particular care to write [our]565-our name in capital letters , [POOTER]114-may , so that there should be no possible mistake this time . May 16.-Absolutely disgusted on opening the Blackfriars Bi - weekly News of to - day , to find the following paragraph : " [We]565-our have received two letters from [Mr.]1499-mr. and [Mrs. Charles Pewter]116-mrs. charles pewter , requesting [us]565-our to announce the important fact that [they]564-the stupid people were at [the Mansion House Ball]23-the mansion house ball . "[0-i] [I]0-i tore up the paper and threw it in the waste - paper basket . [My]0-i time is far too valuable to bother about such trifles . May 21.-The last week or ten days terribly dull , [Carrie]73-carrie being away at [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james 's , at [Sutton]12-sutton . [Cummings]75-cummings also away . [Gowing]76-gowing , [I]0-i presume , is still offended with [me]0-i for black - enamelling [his]76-gowing stick without asking [him]76-gowing . May 22.-Purchased a new stick mounted with silver , which cost seven - and - sixpence ( shall tell [Carrie]73-carrie five shillings ) , and sent it round with nice note to [Gowing]76-gowing . [She]566-she looks wonderfully well , except that the sun has caught [her]566-she nose . May 25.-Carrie brought down some of [my]0-i shirts and advised [me]0-i to take them to [Trillip]117-trillip 's round the corner . [She]566-she said : " The fronts and cuffs are much frayed . "[568-the driver going to town on the ' bus] [Some people]574-some people seem to be quite destitute of a sense of humour . June 1.-The last week has been like old times , [Carrie]73-carrie being back , and [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings calling every evening nearly . Twice [we]575-we sat out in [the garden]328-the garden quite late . This evening [we]575-we were like a pack of [children]577-children , and played " consequences . "[119-june] It is a good game . [June]119-june 2.-"Consequences "[119-june] again this evening . Not quite so successful as last night ; [Gowing]76-gowing having several times over - stepped the limits of good taste . June 4.-In the evening [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i went round to [Mr.]578-mr. and [Mrs. Cummings]75-cummings ' to spend a quiet evening with [them]579-them . [Gowing]76-gowing was there , also [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook . It was quiet but pleasant . [I]0-i think it is called , " [I]0-i would that [my]0-i love ! "[0-i] It was beautiful . If [Carrie]73-carrie had been in better voice , [I]0-i do n't think [professionals]580-professionals could have sung it better . After supper [we]581-we made [them]579-them sing it again . [I]0-i never liked [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook since the walk that Sunday to the " Cow and Hedge , "[86-mr. stillbrook] but [I]0-i must say [he]86-mr. stillbrook sings comic - songs well . June 6.-Trillip brought round the shirts and , to [my]0-i disgust , [his]86-mr. stillbrook charge for repairing was more than [I]0-i gave for them when new . "[86-mr. stillbrook]

[June]119-june 7.-A dreadful annoyance . Met [Mr. Franching]108-franching , who lives at [Peckham]22-peckham , and who is a great swell in [his]108-franching way . [I]0-i ventured to ask [him]86-mr. stillbrook to come [home]287-home to meat - tea and take pot - luck . "[86-mr. stillbrook] [We]583-we drove up [home]287-home in style , in [a hansom - cab]585-a hansom - cab , and [I]0-i knocked three times at the front door without getting an answer . [I]0-i saw [Carrie]73-carrie , through the panels of ground - glass ( with stars ) , rushing up [stairs]586-stairs . [I]0-i told [Mr. Franching]108-franching to wait at the door while [I]0-i went round to the side . [I]0-i let in [Mr. Franching]108-franching , and showed [him]108-franching into [the drawing - room]506-the drawing - room . [You]108-franching know it 's [Sarah]85-sarah 's holiday , and there 's not a thing in [the house]318-the house , the cold mutton having turned with the hot weather . "[73-carrie]

Eventually [Carrie]73-carrie , like a good creature as [she]73-carrie is , slipped down , washed up the tea - cups , and laid the cloth , and [I]0-i gave [Franching]108-franching [our]591-we views of [Japan]121-japan to look at while [I]0-i ran round to [the butcher 's]592-the butcher 's to get three chops . July 30.-The miserable cold weather is either upsetting [me]0-i or [Carrie]73-carrie , or both . [We]591-we seem to break out into an argument about absolutely nothing , and this unpleasant state of things usually occurs at meal times . This morning , for some unaccountable reason , [we]591-we were talking about balloons , and [we]591-we were as merry as possible ; but the conversation drifted into family matters , during which [Carrie]73-carrie , without the slightest reason , referred in the most uncompli­mentary manner to [[my]0-i poor father]593-my poor father 's pecuniary trouble . [I]0-i retorted by saying that " [Pa]122-pa , at all events , was [a gentleman]317-a gentleman , "[0-i] whereupon [Carrie]73-carrie burst out crying . [I]0-i positively could not eat any breakfast . At [the office]323-the office [I]0-i was sent for by [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , who said [he]88-mr. perkupp was very sorry , but [I]0-i should have to take [my]0-i annual holidays from next Saturday . [Franching]108-franching called at [office]595-office and asked [me]0-i to dine at [[his]108-franching club]596-his club , " [The Constitutional]1510-the constitutional . "[108-franching] Fearing disagreeables at [home]287-home after the " tiff "[108-franching] this morning , [I]0-i sent a telegram to [Carrie]73-carrie , telling [her]73-carrie [I]0-i was going out to dine and [she]73-carrie was not to sit up . Bought a little silver bangle for [Carrie]73-carrie . July 31.-Carrie was very pleased with the bangle , which [I]0-i left with an affectionate note on [her]73-carrie dressing - table last night before going to bed . [I]0-i told [Carrie]73-carrie [we]598-we should have to start for [our]598-we holiday next Saturday . [She]73-carrie replied quite happily that [she]73-carrie did not mind , except that the weather was so bad , and [she]73-carrie feared that [Miss Jibbons]123-miss jibbons would not be able to get [her]73-carrie a seaside dress in time . ' "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie not only , to [my]0-i astonishment , raised an objection to [Broad­stairs]124-broad­stairs , for the first time ; but begged [me]0-i not to use the expression , " Good old , "[0-i] but to leave it to [Mr. Stillbrook]86-mr. stillbrook and [other gentlemen of [his]86-mr. stillbrook type]600-other gentlemen of his type . "[0-i] August 3.-A beautiful day . Looking forward to to - morrow . [Carrie]73-carrie bought a parasol about five feet long . [I]0-i told [her]73-carrie it was ridiculous . "[125-mrs. beck] [The Unexpected Arrival Home of [[our]615-our Son]617-our son]616-the unexpected arrival home of our son , [Willie Lupin Pooter]79-lupin . August 4 - The first post brought a nice letter from [[our]615-our dear son]618-our dear son [Willie]79-lupin , acknowledging a trifling present which [Carrie]73-carrie sent [him]79-lupin , the day before yesterday being [his]79-lupin twentieth birthday . To [our]615-our utter amazement [he]79-lupin turned up [himself]79-lupin in the afternoon , having journeyed all the way from [Oldham]3-oldham . [He]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin had got leave from [the bank]619-the bank , and as Monday was a holiday [he]79-lupin thought [he]79-lupin would give [us]615-our a little surprise . August 5 , [Sunday.-We]132-sunday.-we have not seen [Willie]79-lupin since last Christmas , and are pleased to notice what [a fine young man]620-a fine young man [he]79-lupin has grown . [One]621-one would scarcely believe [he]79-lupin was [[Carrie]73-carrie 's son]622-carrie 's son . [He]79-lupin looks more like [a younger brother]623-a younger brother . [I]0-i rather disapprove of [his]79-lupin wearing a check suit on a Sunday , and [I]0-i think [he]79-lupin ought to have gone to [church]329-church this morning ; but [he]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin was tired after yesterday 's journey , so [I]0-i refrained from any remark on the subject . [We]615-our had a bottle of port for dinner , and drank dear [Willie]79-lupin 's health . [He]79-lupin said : " Oh , by - the - by , did [I]79-lupin tell [you]0-i [I]79-lupin 've cut [my]79-lupin first name , ' [William]133-william , ' and taken the second name ' [Lupin]79-lupin ' ? ' If [you]0-i were to ' [Willie]79-lupin ' [me]79-lupin there , [they]1517-they would n't know what [you]0-i meant . "[79-lupin]

Of course , [Lupin]79-lupin being a purely family name , [Carrie]73-carrie was delighted , and began by giving a long history of [the Lupins]134-the lupins . [I]0-i ventured to say that [I]0-i thought [William]133-william a nice simple name , and reminded [him]133-william [he]133-william was christened after [[his]133-william Uncle [William]133-william , who was much respected in [the City]286-the city]133-william . [Willie]79-lupin , in a manner which [I]0-i did not much care for , said sneeringly : " Oh , [I]79-lupin know all about that - Good old [Bill]79-lupin ! "[79-lupin] and helped [himself]79-lupin to a third glass of port . [Carrie]73-carrie objected strongly to [my]0-i saying " Good old , "[73-carrie] but [she]73-carrie made no remark when [Willie]79-lupin used the double adjective . [I]0-i said nothing , but looked at [her]73-carrie , which meant more . [I]0-i said : " [[My]0-i dear]275-my dear [Willie]79-lupin , [I]0-i hope [you]79-lupin are happy with [[your]79-lupin colleagues at [the bank]619-the bank]1519-your colleagues at the bank . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i felt so shocked , [I]0-i could say nothing , and [my]0-i instinct told [me]0-i there was something wrong . August 6 , Bank Holiday.-As there was no sign of [Lupin]79-lupin moving at nine o'clock , [I]0-i knocked at [his]79-lupin door , and said [we]626-we usually breakfasted at half - past eight , and asked how long would [he]79-lupin be ? [Lupin]79-lupin replied that [he]79-lupin had had a lively time of it , first with [the train]627-the train shaking [the house]318-the house all night , and then with the sun streaming in through the window in [his]79-lupin eyes , and giving [him]79-lupin a cracking headache . [Carrie]73-carrie came up and asked if [he]79-lupin would like some breakfast sent up , and [he]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin could do with a cup of tea , and did n't want anything to eat . [Lupin]79-lupin not having come down , [I]0-i went up again at half - past one , and said [we]626-we dined at two ; [he]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin " would be [there]1525-there . "[79-lupin] [He]79-lupin never came down till a quarter to three . [I]0-i said : " [We]626-we have not seen much of [you]79-lupin , and [you]79-lupin will have to return by [the 5.30 train]1526-the 5.30 train ; therefore [you]79-lupin will have to leave in an hour , unless [you]79-lupin go by the midnight mail . "[0-i] [He]79-lupin said : " Look here , [Guv'nor]135-guv'nor , it 's no use beating about the bush . [I]79-lupin 've tendered [my]79-lupin resignation at [the Bank]619-the bank . "[79-lupin] For a moment [I]0-i could not speak . When [my]0-i speech came again , [I]0-i said : " How dare [you]79-lupin , [sir]1428-sir ? How dare [you]79-lupin take such a serious step without consulting [me]0-i ? Do n't answer [me]0-i , [sir!-you]1529-sir!-you will sit down immediately , and write a note at [my]0-i dictation , withdrawing [your]79-lupin resignation and amply apologising for [your]79-lupin thought­lessness . "[0-i] Imagine [my]0-i dismay when [he]79-lupin replied with a loud guffaw : " It 's no use . If [you]0-i want the good old truth , [I]79-lupin 've got the chuck ! "[79-lupin] August 7.-Mr . [Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp has given [me]0-i leave to postpone [my]0-i holiday a week , as [we]629-we could not get [the room]410-the room . August 11.-Although it is a serious matter having [[our]629-we boy]296-our boy [Lupin]79-lupin on [our]629-we hands , still it is satisfactory to know [he]79-lupin was asked to resign from [the Bank]619-the bank simply because " [he]79-lupin took no interest in [his]79-lupin work , and always arrived an hour ( sometimes two hours ) late . "[629-we] [We]629-we can all start off on Monday to [Broad­stairs]124-broad­stairs with a light heart . This will take [my]0-i mind off the worry of the last few days , which have been wasted over a useless correspondence with [the manager of [the Bank at [Oldham]3-oldham]297-the bank at oldham]634-the manager of the bank at oldham . August 13.-Hurrah ! at [Broad­stairs]124-broad­stairs . [Very nice apartments near [the station]637-the station]636-very nice apartments near the station . On [the cliff]638-the cliff [they]636-very nice apartments near the station would have been double the price . [The landlady]639-the landlady had a nice five o'clock dinner and tea ready , which [we]629-we all enjoyed , though [Lupin]79-lupin seemed fastidious because there happened to be a fly in the butter . It was very wet in the evening , for which [I]0-i was thankful , as it was a good excuse for going to bed early . [Lupin]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin would sit up and read a bit . August 14.-I was a little annoyed to find [Lupin]79-lupin , instead of reading last night , had gone to a common sort of entertainment , given at [the Assembly Rooms]640-the assembly rooms . [I]0-i expressed [my]0-i opinion that such performances were unworthy of respectable patronage ; but [he]79-lupin replied : " Oh , it was only ' for one night only . ' [I]79-lupin had a fit of the blues come on , and thought [I]79-lupin would go to see [Polly Presswell]136-polly presswell , [England]30-england 's Particular Spark . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i told [him]79-lupin [I]0-i was proud to say [I]0-i had never heard of [her]641-her . [Carrie]73-carrie said : " Do let [the boy]363-the boy alone . [He]363-the boy 's quite old enough to take care of [himself]363-the boy , and wo n't forget [he]363-the boy 's [a gentleman]317-a gentleman . Remember [you]0-i were young once [yourself]0-i . "[73-carrie] Rained all day hard , but [Lupin]79-lupin would go out . [August]126-august 15.-Cleared up a bit ; so [we]642-we all took [the train]627-the train to [Margate]31-margate , and [the first person [we]642-we met on [the jetty]645-the jetty]644-the first person we met on the jetty was [Gowing]76-gowing . [I]0-i said : " Hulloh ! [I]0-i thought [you]76-gowing had gone to [Barmouth]32-barmouth with [[your]76-gowing Birmingham friends]1532-your birmingham friends ? "[0-i] [He]76-gowing said : " Yes , but [young Peter Lawrence]137-young peter lawrence was so ill , [they]1532-your birmingham friends postponed [their]1532-your birmingham friends visit , so [I]76-gowing came down here . [You]73-carrie know [the Cummings]1533-the cummings ' are here too ? "[76-gowing] [Carrie]73-carrie said : " Oh , that will be delightful ! [We]642-we must have some evenings together and have games . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " How 's that ? [You]0-i do n't mean to say [he]1534-our dear boy 's left [the Bank]619-the bank ? "[76-gowing] [I]0-i changed the subject quickly , and thereby avoided any of those awkward questions which [Gowing]76-gowing always has a knack of asking . [August]126-august 16.-Lupin positively refused to walk down [the Parade]646-the parade with [me]0-i because [I]0-i was wearing [my]0-i new straw helmet with [my]0-i frock - coat . [I]0-i do n't know what [the boy]363-the boy is coming to .

[August]126-august 17.-Lupin not falling in with [our]648-our views , [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i went for a sail . It was a relief to be with [her]73-carrie alone ; for when [Lupin]79-lupin irritates [me]0-i , [she]73-carrie always sides with [him]79-lupin . On [our]648-our return , [he]76-gowing said : " Oh , [you]0-i 've been on the ' Shilling Emetic , ' have [you]0-i ? [You]0-i 'll come to six - pennorth on the ' Liver Jerker ' next . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i presume [he]76-gowing meant a tricycle , but [I]0-i affected not to understand [him]76-gowing . August 18.-Gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings walked over to arrange an evening at [Margate]31-margate . It being wet , [Gowing]76-gowing asked [Cummings]75-cummings to accompany [him]76-gowing to [the hotel]649-the hotel and have a game of billiards , knowing [I]0-i never play , and in fact disapprove of the game . [Cummings]75-cummings said [he]76-gowing must hasten back to [Margate]31-margate ; whereupon [Lupin]79-lupin , to [my]0-i horror , said : " [I]79-lupin 'll give [you]76-gowing a game , [Gowing]76-gowing - a hundred up . A walk round the cloth will give [me]79-lupin an appetite for dinner . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i said : " Perhaps [Mister Gowing]76-gowing does not care to play with [boys]1537-boys . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing surprised [me]0-i by saying : " Oh yes , [I]76-gowing do , if [they]1537-boys play well , "[76-gowing] and [they]650-they walked off together . August 19 , [Sunday.-I]138-sunday.-i was about to read [Lupin]79-lupin a sermon on smoking ( which [he]79-lupin indulges in violently ) and billiards , but [he]79-lupin put on [his]79-lupin hat and walked out . [Carrie]73-carrie then read [me]0-i a long sermon on the palpable inadvisability of treating [Lupin]79-lupin as if [he]79-lupin were [a mere child]651-a mere child . [I]0-i felt [she]73-carrie was somewhat right , so in the evening [I]0-i offered [him]76-gowing a cigar . [He]76-gowing seemed pleased , but , after a few whiffs , said : " This is a good old tup'ny - try one of mine , "[76-gowing] and [he]76-gowing handed [me]0-i a cigar as long as it was strong , which is saying a good deal .

August 20.-I am glad [our]652-we last day at [the seaside]607-the seaside was fine , though clouded overhead . [We]652-we went over to [[Cummings]75-cummings ' ( at [Margate]31-margate]654-cummings ' ( at margate ) in the evening , and as it was cold , [we]652-we stayed in and played games ; [Gowing]76-gowing , as usual , overstepping the mark . [He]76-gowing suggested [we]652-we should play " Cutlets , "[76-gowing] a game [we]652-we never heard of . [He]76-gowing sat on a chair , and asked [Carrie]73-carrie to sit on [his]76-gowing lap , an invitation which [dear Carrie]73-carrie rightly declined . After some species of wrangling , [I]0-i sat on [Gowing]76-gowing 's knees and [Carrie]73-carrie sat on the edge of [mine]0-i . [Lupin]79-lupin sat on the edge of [Carrie]73-carrie 's lap , then [Cummings]75-cummings on [Lupin]79-lupin 's , and [Mrs. Cummings]75-cummings on [[her]75-cummings husband]423-her husband 's . [We]652-we looked very ridiculous , and laughed a good deal . [Gowing]76-gowing then said : " Are [you]0-i a believer in [the Great Mogul]1538-the great mogul ? "[76-gowing] [We]652-we had to answer all together : " Yes - oh , yes ! "[76-gowing] ( three times ) . [Gowing]76-gowing said : " So am [I]76-gowing , "[76-gowing] and suddenly got up . The result of this stupid joke was that [we]652-we all fell on the ground , and poor [Carrie]73-carrie banged [her]73-carrie head against the corner of the fender . [Mrs. Cummings]75-cummings put some vinegar on ; but through this [we]652-we missed [the last train]656-the last train , and had to drive back to [Broad­stairs]124-broad­stairs , which cost [me]0-i seven - and - sixpence .
