[Lupin]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin was not a bit surprised at [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james ' visit , but was surprised at [her]94-mrs. james . August 26 , [Sunday.-Nearly]142-sunday.-nearly late for [church]329-church , [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james having talked considerably about what to wear all the morning . [Lupin]79-lupin does not seem to get on very well with [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james . [I]0-i am afraid [we]669-we shall have some trouble with [[our]669-we next - door neighbours who came in last Wednesday]670-our next - door neighbours who came in last wednesday . [Several of [[their]670-our next - door neighbours who came in last wednesday friends]672-their friends , who drive up in [dog - carts]673-dog - carts]671-several of their friends , who drive up in dog - carts , have already made [themselves]671-several of their friends , who drive up in dog - carts objectionable . An evening or two ago [I]0-i had put on a white waistcoat for coolness , and while walking past with [my]0-i thumbs in [my]0-i waistcoat pockets ( a habit [I]0-i have ) , [one man]674-one man , seated in the cart , and looking like [an American]675-an american , commenced singing some vulgar nonsense about " [I]674-one man had thirteen dollars in [my]674-one man waistcoat pocket . "[674-one man] [I]0-i fancied it was meant for [me]0-i , and [my]0-i suspicions were confirmed ; for while walking round [the garden]328-the garden in [my]0-i tall hat this afternoon , a " throw - down "[677-the man who was in the cart retreating from one of the bedroom windows] cracker was deliberately aimed at [my]0-i hat , and exploded on it like a percussion cap . [I]0-i turned sharply , and am positive [I]0-i saw [the man who was in the cart retreating from one of the bedroom windows]677-the man who was in the cart retreating from one of the bedroom windows . August 27.-Carrie and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james went off shopping , and had not returned when [I]0-i came back from [the office]323-the office . Judging from the subsequent conversation , [I]0-i am afraid [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james is filling [Carrie]73-carrie 's head with a lot of nonsense about dress . [I]0-i walked over to [Gowing]76-gowing 's , and asked [him]76-gowing to drop in to supper , and make things pleasant . [Carrie]73-carrie prepared a little extemporised supper , consisting of the remainder of the cold joint , a small piece of salmon ( which [I]0-i was to refuse , in case there was not enough to go round ) , and a blanc - mange and custards . There was also a decanter of port and some jam puffs on the sideboard . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james made [us]679-us play rather a good game with cards , called " [Muggins]143-muggins . "[94-mrs. james] To [my]0-i surprise , in fact disgust , [Lupin]79-lupin got up in the middle , and , in a most sarcastic tone , said : " Pardon [me]79-lupin , this sort of thing is too fast for [me]79-lupin . "[79-lupin] Things might have become rather disagreeable but for [Gowing]76-gowing ( who seems to have taken to [Lupin]79-lupin ) suggesting [they]679-us should invent games . [I]0-i must confess [I]0-i laughed heartily at this . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james went [home]287-home , and both [Lupin]79-lupin and [I]0-i were somewhat pleased - the first time [we]684-we have agreed on a single subject since [his]79-lupin return . [Merkins]145-merkins and [Son]146-son write [they]145-merkins have no vacancy for [Lupin]79-lupin . October 30.-I should very much like to know who has wilfully torn the last five or six weeks out of [my]0-i diary . It is perfectly monstrous ! [Mine]0-i is a large scribbling diary , with plenty of space for the record of [my]0-i everyday events , and in keeping up that record [I]0-i take ( with much pride ) a great deal of pains . [I]0-i asked [Carrie]73-carrie if [she]73-carrie knew anything about it . [She]73-carrie replied it was [my]0-i own fault for leaving the diary about with [a charwoman]685-a charwoman cleaning and the sweeps in [the house]318-the house . [I]0-i said that was not an answer to [my]0-i question . This retort of [mine]0-i , which [I]0-i thought extremely smart , would have been more effective had [I]0-i not jogged [my]0-i elbow against a vase on a table temporarily placed in [the passage]687-the passage , knocked it over , and smashed it . [Carrie]73-carrie was dreadfully upset at this disaster , for it was one of a pair of vases which can not be matched , given to [us]688-us on [our]688-us wedding - day by [Mrs. Burtsett]147-mrs. burtsett , [an old friend of [[Carrie]73-carrie 's cousins]690-carrie 's cousins , [the Pommertons]148-the pommertons , [late of [Dalston]149-dalston]691-late of dalston]689-an old friend of carrie 's cousins , the pommertons , late of dalston . Finding a burnt piece of paper in the grate , [I]0-i examined it , and found it was a piece of [my]0-i diary . So it was evident [someone]311-someone had torn [my]0-i diary to light the fire . [I]0-i requested [Mrs. Birrell]150-mrs. birrell to be sent to [me]0-i to - morrow . October 31.-Received a letter from [[our]696-our principal]366-our principal , [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , saying that [he]88-mr. perkupp thinks [he]88-mr. perkupp knows of a place at last for [[our]696-our dear boy [Lupin]79-lupin]698-our dear boy lupin . November 1.-My entry yesterday about " retired tired , "[700-the sweep] which [I]0-i did not notice at the time , is rather funny . If [I]0-i were not so worried just now , [I]0-i might have had a little joke about it . [The sweep]700-the sweep called , but had the audacity to come up to [the hall]701-the hall - door and lean [his]79-lupin dirty bag of soot on the door - step . [He]79-lupin , however , was so polite , [I]0-i could not rebuke [him]79-lupin . [He]79-lupin said [Sarah]85-sarah lighted the fire . Unfortunately , [Sarah]85-sarah heard this , for [she]85-sarah was dusting the banisters , and [she]85-sarah ran down , and flew into a temper with the sweep , causing a row on the front door - steps , which [I]0-i would not have had happen for anything . [I]0-i ordered [her]85-sarah about [her]85-sarah business , and told [the sweep]700-the sweep [I]0-i was sorry to have troubled [him]79-lupin ; and so [I]0-i was , for the door - steps were covered with soot in consequence of [his]79-lupin visit . [I]0-i would willingly give ten shillings to find out who tore [my]0-i diary . November 2.-I spent the evening quietly with [Carrie]73-carrie , of whose company [I]0-i never tire . [We]703-we had a most pleasant chat about the letters on " Is Marriage a Failure ? "[73-carrie] It has been no failure in [our]703-we case . In talking over [our]703-we own happy experiences , [we]703-we never noticed that it was past midnight . [We]703-we were startled by hearing the door slam violently . [Lupin]79-lupin had come in . [He]79-lupin made no attempt to turn down the gas in [the passage]687-the passage , or even to look into [the room where [we]703-we were]705-the room where we were , but went straight up to bed , making a terrible noise . [I]0-i asked [him]79-lupin to come down for a moment , and [he]79-lupin begged to be excused , as [he]79-lupin was " dead beat , "[79-lupin] an observation that was scarcely consistent with the fact that , for a quarter of an hour afterwards , [he]79-lupin was positively dancing in [[his]79-lupin room]706-his room , and shouting out , " See [me]79-lupin dance the polka ! "[79-lupin] or some such nonsense . November 3.-Good news at last . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp has got an appointment for [Lupin]79-lupin , and [he]88-mr. perkupp is to go and see about it on Monday . Oh , how [my]0-i mind is relieved ! [I]0-i went to [[Lupin]79-lupin 's room]707-lupin 's room to take the good news to [him]79-lupin , but [he]79-lupin was in bed , very seedy , so [I]0-i resolved to keep it over till the evening . [He]79-lupin said [he]79-lupin had last night been elected [a member of [an Amateur Dramatic Club]709-an amateur dramatic club]708-a member of an amateur dramatic club , called the " [Holloway Comedians "]1540-holloway comedians "[79-lupin] ; and , though it was a pleasant evening , [he]79-lupin had sat in a draught , and got neuralgia in the head . [He]79-lupin declined have any breakfast , so [I]0-i left [him]79-lupin . In the evening [I]0-i had up a special bottle of port , and , [Lupin]79-lupin being in for a wonder , [we]710-we filled [our]710-we glasses , and [I]0-i said : " [Lupin]79-lupin [[my]0-i boy]1500-my boy , [I]0-i have some good and unexpected news for [you]79-lupin . "[73-carrie] [Lupin]79-lupin said : " Oh , it 's all right ! [I]79-lupin 'm engaged to be married ! "[79-lupin]

[He]79-lupin said [the lady]715-the lady 's name was [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar , and [she]715-the lady was [the nicest , prettiest , and most accomplished girl [he]79-lupin ever met]716-the nicest , prettiest , and most accomplished girl he ever met . [Lupin]79-lupin further said , with much warmth , that [the world]389-the world was [a different world to [him]79-lupin]718-a different world to him now,-it was [a world worth living in]719-a world worth living in . [He]79-lupin lived with an object now , and that was to make [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar - [Daisy Pooter]114-may , and [he]79-lupin would guarantee [she]151-daisy mutlar would not disgrace [the family of [the Pooters]152-the pooters]720-the family of the pooters . [Carrie]73-carrie here burst out crying , and threw [her]73-carrie arms round [his]79-lupin neck , and in doing so , upset the glass of port [he]79-lupin held in [his]79-lupin hand all over [his]79-lupin new light trousers . [I]0-i said [I]0-i had no doubt [we]721-we should like [Miss Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar when [we]721-we saw [her]151-daisy mutlar , but [Carrie]73-carrie said [she]73-carrie loved [her]151-daisy mutlar already . [I]0-i thought this rather premature , but held [my]0-i tongue . [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar was the sole topic of conversation for the remainder of the day . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i did not know , but refrained from asking any further questions at present , for fear of irritating [Lupin]79-lupin . [November 6.-Lupin]155-november went with [me]0-i to [the office]323-the office , and had a long conversation with [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , [[our]724-our principal]366-our principal , the result of which was that [he]88-mr. perkupp accepted a clerkship in [the firm of [Job Cleanands & Co.]727-job cleanands & co.]726-the firm of job cleanands & co. , [Stock]728-stock and [Share Brokers]729-share brokers . [Lupin]79-lupin told [me]0-i , privately , it was [an advertising firm]730-an advertising firm , and [he]79-lupin did not think much of it . [I]0-i replied : " [Beggars]1542-beggars should not be [choosers]1543-choosers ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i will do [Lupin]79-lupin the justice to say , [he]79-lupin looked rather ashamed of [himself]79-lupin . In the evening [we]724-our went round to [the Cummings ']712-the cummings ' , to have a few fireworks . It began to rain , and [I]0-i thought it rather dull . One of [my]0-i squibs would not go off , and [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Hit it on [your]733-the little cummings ' boy boot , [boy]1544-boy ; it will go off then . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i gave it a few knocks on the end of [my]0-i boot , and it went off with one loud explosion , and burnt [my]0-i fingers rather badly . [I]0-i gave the rest of the squibs to [[the little Cummings]732-the little cummings ' boy]733-the little cummings ' boy to let off . Another unfortunate thing happened , which brought a heap of abuse on [my]0-i head . [Cummings]75-cummings fastened a large wheel set - piece on a stake in the ground by way of a grand finale . [He]712-the cummings ' made a great fuss about it ; said it cost seven shillings . There was a little difficulty in getting it alight . At last it went off ; but after a couple of slow revolutions , it stopped . [I]0-i had [my]0-i stick with [me]0-i , so [I]0-i gave it a tap to send it round , and , unfortunately , it fell off the stake on to the grass . [Anybody]1466-anybody would have thought [I]0-i had set [the house]318-the house on fire from the way in which [they]736-they stormed at [me]0-i . [I]0-i will never join in any more firework parties . It is a ridiculous waste of time and money . November 7.-Lupin asked [Carrie]73-carrie to call on [Mrs. Mutlar]156-mrs. mutlar , but [Carrie]73-carrie said [she]73-carrie thought [Mrs. Mutlar]156-mrs. mutlar ought to call on [her]73-carrie first . [I]0-i agreed with [Carrie]73-carrie , and this led to an argument . However , the matter was settled by [Carrie]73-carrie saying [she]73-carrie could not find any visiting - cards , and [we]737-us must get some more printed , and when [they]738-they were finished would be quite time enough to discuss the etiquette of calling . November 8.-I ordered some of [our]737-us cards at [Black]157-black 's , [the stationer]739-the stationer 's . [I]0-i ordered twenty - five of each , which will last [us]737-us for a good long time . In the evening , [Lupin]79-lupin brought in [Harry Mutlar]158-harry mutlar , [[Miss Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar 's brother]740-miss mutlar 's brother . [He]158-harry mutlar was rather [a gawky youth]741-a gawky youth , and [Lupin]79-lupin said [he]158-harry mutlar was [the most popular and best amateur in [the club]743-the club]742-the most popular and best amateur in the club , referring to [the " Holloway Comedians]159-the " holloway comedians . "[79-lupin] [Lupin]79-lupin whispered to [us]737-us that if [we]737-us could only " draw out "[79-lupin] [Harry]158-harry mutlar a bit , [he]158-harry mutlar would make [us]737-us roar with laughter . At supper , [young Mutlar]158-harry mutlar did several amusing things . [He]158-harry mutlar took up a knife , and with the flat part of it played a tune on [his]158-harry mutlar cheek in a wonderful manner . [He]158-harry mutlar also gave an imitation of [an old man with no teeth]744-an old man with no teeth , smoking a big cigar . The way [he]158-harry mutlar kept dropping the cigar sent [Carrie]73-carrie into fits . In the course of conversation , [Daisy]151-daisy mutlar 's name cropped up , and [young Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar said [he]158-harry mutlar would bring [[his]158-harry mutlar sister]745-his sister round to [us]737-us one evening - [[his]158-harry mutlar parents]746-his parents being rather old - fashioned , and not going out much . [Carrie]73-carrie said [we]737-us would get up a little special party . As [young Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar showed no inclination to go , and it was approaching eleven o'clock , as a hint [I]0-i reminded [Lupin]79-lupin that [he]79-lupin had to be up early to - morrow . Instead of taking the hint , [Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar began a series of comic imitations . [He]158-harry mutlar went on for an hour without cessation . [Poor Carrie]73-carrie could scarcely keep [her]73-carrie eyes open . At last [she]73-carrie made an excuse , and said " Good - night . "[73-carrie] [Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar then left , and [I]0-i heard [him]158-harry mutlar and [Lupin]79-lupin whispering in [the hall]701-the hall something about the " Holloway Comedians , "[158-harry mutlar] and to [my]0-i disgust , although it was past midnight , [Lupin]79-lupin put on [his]79-lupin hat and coat , and went out with [[his]79-lupin new companion]748-his new companion .

November 9.-My endeavours to discover who tore the sheets out of [my]0-i diary still fruitless . [Lupin]79-lupin has [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar on the brain , so [we]749-we see little of [him]79-lupin , except that [he]79-lupin invariably turns up at meal times . [Cummings]75-cummings dropped in . November 10.-Lupin seems to like [his]79-lupin new berth - that 's a comfort . [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar the sole topic of conversation during tea . [Carrie]73-carrie almost as full of it as [Lupin]79-lupin . [Lupin]79-lupin informs [me]0-i , to [my]0-i disgust , that [he]79-lupin has been persuaded to take part in the forthcoming performance of the " [Holloway Comedians]159-the " holloway comedians . "[79-lupin] [He]79-lupin says [he]79-lupin is to play [Bob Britches]160-bob britches in the farce , Gone to [[my]0-i Uncle]750-my uncle 's ; [Frank Mutlar]161-frank is going to play [Old Musty]162-old musty . [I]0-i told [Lupin]79-lupin pretty plainly [I]0-i was not in the least degree interested in the matter , and totally disapproved of amateur theatricals . [Gowing]76-gowing came in the evening . [November]155-november 11.-Returned [home]287-home to find [the house]318-the house in a most disgraceful uproar . [Carrie]73-carrie , who appeared very frightened , was standing outside [[her]73-carrie bedroom]753-her bedroom , while [Sarah]85-sarah was excited and crying . [Mrs. Birrell]150-mrs. birrell ( [the charwoman ) , who had evidently been drinking]754-the charwoman ) , who had evidently been drinking , was shouting at the top of [her]150-mrs. birrell voice that " [she]150-mrs. birrell was [no thief]1545-no thief , that [she]150-mrs. birrell was [a respectable woman]1546-a respectable woman , who had to work hard for [her]150-mrs. birrell living , and [she]150-mrs. birrell would smack [anyone]1547-anyone 's face who put lies into [her]150-mrs. birrell mouth . "[150-mrs. birrell] [Lupin]79-lupin , whose back was towards [me]0-i , did not hear [me]0-i come in . [He]79-lupin was standing between [the two women]755-the two women , and , [I]0-i regret to say , in [his]79-lupin endeavour to act as [peacemaker]756-peacemaker , [he]79-lupin made use of rather strong language in the presence of [[his]79-lupin mother]757-his mother ; and [I]0-i was just in time to hear [him]79-lupin say : " And all this fuss about the loss of a few pages from a rotten diary that would n't fetch three - halfpence a pound ! "[79-lupin] [I]0-i said , quietly : " Pardon [me]0-i , [Lupin]79-lupin , that is a matter of opinion ; and as [I]0-i am [master of [this house]1549-this house]1548-master of this house , perhaps [you]79-lupin will allow [me]0-i to take the reins . "[0-i] [I]0-i ascertained that the cause of the row was , that [Sarah]85-sarah had accused [Mrs. Birrell]150-mrs. birrell of tearing the pages out of [my]0-i diary to wrap up some kitchen fat and leavings which [she]150-mrs. birrell had taken out of [the house]318-the house last week . [Mrs. Birrell]150-mrs. birrell had slapped [Sarah]85-sarah 's face , and said [she]150-mrs. birrell had taken nothing out of [the place]759-the place , as there was " never no leavings to take . "[150-mrs. birrell] [I]0-i ordered [Sarah]85-sarah back to [her]85-sarah work , and requested [Mrs. Birrell]150-mrs. birrell to go [home]287-home . When [I]0-i entered [the parlour]408-the parlour [Lupin]79-lupin was kicking [his]79-lupin legs in the air , and roaring with laughter .

November 12 , Sunday.-Coming [home]287-home from [church]329-church [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i met [Lupin]79-lupin , [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar , and [[her]73-carrie brother]764-her brother . November 14.-Everybody so far has accepted for [our]774-our quite grand little party for to - morrow . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , in a nice letter , which [I]0-i shall keep , wrote that [he]88-mr. perkupp was dining in [Kensington]33-kensington , but if [he]88-mr. perkupp could get away , [he]88-mr. perkupp would come up to [Holloway]2-holloway for an hour . [Carrie]73-carrie was busy all day , making little cakes and open jam puffs and jellies . [She]73-carrie said [she]73-carrie felt quite nervous about [her]73-carrie responsi­bilities to - morrow evening . [We]774-our decided to have some light things on the table , such as sandwiches , cold chicken and ham , and some sweets , and on the sideboard a nice piece of cold beef and a Paysandu tongue for [the more hungry ones]777-the more hungry ones to peg into if [they]777-the more hungry ones liked . "[73-carrie]

[I]0-i dressed early in case [people]541-people should arrive punctually at eight o'clock , and was much vexed to find [my]0-i new dress trousers much too short . "[79-lupin] It seemed a pretty song , but [she]151-daisy mutlar made such grimaces , and sang , to [my]0-i mind , so out of tune , [I]0-i would not have asked [her]151-daisy mutlar to sing again ; but [Lupin]79-lupin made [her]151-daisy mutlar sing four songs right off , one after the other . At ten o'clock [we]803-we went down to supper , and from the way [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings ate [you]806-you would have thought [they]807-they had not had a meal for a month . [I]0-i told [Carrie]73-carrie to keep something back in case [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp should come by mere chance . ' "[171-mr. watson] [We]803-we were directed to form a circle - which [we]803-we did . "[171-mr. watson] [Frank]161-frank and [Lupin]79-lupin then bounded into [the room]410-the room . [He]161-frank was supposed to be the donkey , and [he]161-frank looked it . [They]809-the young fellows indulged in a very noisy pantomime , and [we]803-we were all shrieking with laughter . [I]0-i turned round suddenly , and then [I]0-i saw [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp standing half - way in the door , [he]88-mr. perkupp having arrived without [our]803-we knowing it . [I]0-i apologised for the foolery , but [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp said : " Oh , it seems amusing . "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i could see [he]88-mr. perkupp was not a bit amused . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i took [him]88-mr. perkupp [downstairs]815-downstairs , but the table was a wreck . There was not a glass of champagne left - not even a sandwich . [Carrie]73-carrie said : " [We]803-we have plenty of port wine left . "[73-carrie] [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp said , with a smile : " No , thank [you]0-i . "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i went with [him]88-mr. perkupp to [[his]88-mr. perkupp carriage]816-his carriage , and [he]88-mr. perkupp said : " Do n't trouble to come to [the office]323-the office till twelve to - morrow . "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i felt despondent as [I]0-i went back to [the house]318-the house , and [I]0-i told [Carrie]73-carrie [I]0-i thought the party was a failure . [Carrie]73-carrie said it was a great success , and [I]0-i was only tired , and insisted on [my]0-i having some port [myself]0-i . [I]0-i drank two glasses , and felt much better , and [we]818-we went into [the drawing - room]506-the drawing - room , where [they]820-they had commenced dancing . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i had a little dance , which [I]0-i said reminded [me]0-i of old days . [She]73-carrie said [I]0-i was [a spooney old thing]821-a spooney old thing . [Reflections]172-reflections . [I]0-i make another Good Joke . Am annoyed at the constant serving - up of the " [Blanc - Mange]173-blanc - mange . "[79-lupin] [Lupin]79-lupin expresses [his]79-lupin opinion of [Weddings]174-weddings . [Lupin]79-lupin falls out with [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar . November 16 - Woke about twenty times during the night , with terrible thirst . Finished off all the water in the bottle , as well as half that in the jug . Kept dreaming , also , that last night 's party was a failure , and that a lot of [low people]822-low people came without invitation , and kept chaffing and throwing things at [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , till at last [I]0-i was obliged to hide [him]88-mr. perkupp in [the box - room ( which [we]824-we had just discovered )]823-the box - room ( which we had just discovered ) , with a bath - towel over [him]88-mr. perkupp . It seems absurd now , but it was painfully real in the dream . [I]0-i had the same dream about a dozen times .

[Carrie]73-carrie annoyed [me]0-i by saying : " [You]0-i know champagne never agrees with [you]0-i . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i told [her]73-carrie [I]0-i had only a couple of glasses of it , having kept [myself]0-i entirely to port . [I]0-i added that good champagne hurt [nobody]310-nobody , and [Lupin]79-lupin told [me]0-i [he]79-lupin had only got it from [a traveller]826-a traveller as a favour , as that particular brand had been entirely bought up by [a West - End club]827-a west - end club . [I]0-i think [I]0-i ate too heartily of the " side dishes , "[794-the waiter] as [the waiter]794-the waiter called them . [I]0-i said to [Carrie]73-carrie : " [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had put those ' side dishes ' aside . "[0-i] [I]0-i repeated this , but [Carrie]73-carrie was busy , packing up the teaspoons [we]829-we had borrowed of [Mrs. Cummings]75-cummings for the party . "[79-lupin] On the spur of the moment [I]0-i said the cleverest thing [I]0-i think [I]0-i have ever said ; viz . : " Perhaps that accounts for the parashooting pains . "[829-we] [We]829-we all three roared . November 17.-Still feel tired and headachy ! In the evening [Gowing]76-gowing called , and was full of praise about [our]829-we party last Wednesday . [He]76-gowing said everything was done beautifully , and [he]76-gowing enjoyed [himself]76-gowing enormously . [Gowing]76-gowing can be [a very nice fellow]831-a very nice fellow when [he]76-gowing likes , but [you]832-you never know how long it will last . For instance , [he]76-gowing stopped to supper , and seeing [some blanc - mange on the table]833-some blanc - mange on the table , shouted out , while [the servant]281-the servant was in [the room]410-the room : " Hulloh ! The remains of Wednesday ? "[281-the servant] [November]155-november 18.-Woke up quite fresh after a good night 's rest , and feel quite [myself]0-i again . [I]0-i am satisfied a life of going - out and Society is not a life for [me]0-i ; [we]829-we therefore declined the invitation which [we]829-we received this morning to [Miss Bird]177-miss bird 's wedding . [We]829-we only met [her]177-miss bird twice at [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james ' , and it means a present . [Lupin]79-lupin said : " [I]79-lupin am with [you]155-november for once . To [my]79-lupin mind a wedding 's a very poor play . There are only two parts in it - [the bride]1568-the bride and [bridegroom]1569-bridegroom . [The best man]1570-the best man is only [a walking gentleman]1571-a walking gentleman . With the exception of [a crying father]1572-a crying father and [a snivelling mother]1573-a snivelling mother , the rest are supers who have to dress well and have to pay for [their]1574-their insignificant parts in the shape of costly presents . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i did not care for the theatrical slang , but thought it clever , though disrespectful . [I]0-i told [Sarah]85-sarah not to bring up the blanc - mange again for breakfast . It seems to have been placed on [our]829-we table at every meal since Wednesday . [Cummings]75-cummings came round in the evening , and congratulated [us]829-we on the success of [our]829-we party . [He]836-he said it was the best party [he]836-he had been to for many a year ; but [he]836-he wished [we]829-we had let [him]836-he know it was full dress , as [he]836-he would have turned up in [his]836-he swallow - tails . [We]829-we sat down to a quiet game of dominoes , and were interrupted by the noisy entrance of [Lupin]79-lupin and [Frank Mutlar]161-frank . Have [you]79-lupin [an estate in [Greenland]36-greenland]1575-an estate in greenland ? "[79-lupin] It was simply Greek to [me]0-i , but it appears it is one of the customs of the " Holloway Comedians "[79-lupin] to do this when [a member]838-a member displays ignorance . In spite of [my]0-i instructions , that [blanc - mange]839-blanc - mange was brought up again for supper . To make matters worse , there had been an attempt to disguise it , by placing it in a glass dish with jam round it . November 19 , Sunday.-A delightfully quiet day . In the afternoon [Lupin]79-lupin was off to spend the rest of the day with [the Mutlars]178-the mutlars . [He]79-lupin departed in the best of spirits , and [Carrie]73-carrie said : " Well , one advantage of [Lupin]79-lupin 's engagement with [Daisy]151-daisy mutlar is that [the boy]363-the boy seems happy all day long . That quite reconciles [me]73-carrie to what [I]73-carrie must confess seems an imprudent engagement . "[73-carrie] [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i talked the matter over during the evening , and agreed that it did not always follow that an early engagement meant an unhappy marriage . [Dear Carrie]73-carrie reminded [me]0-i that [we]840-we married early , and , with the exception of a few trivial misunder­standings , [we]840-we had never had a really serious word . [I]0-i could not help thinking ( as [I]0-i told [her]73-carrie ) that half the pleasures of life were derived from the little struggles and small privations that [one]621-one had to endure at the beginning of one 's married life . Such struggles were generally occasioned by want of means , and often helped to make [loving couples]844-loving couples stand together all the firmer . [Carrie]73-carrie said [I]0-i had expressed [myself]0-i wonderfully well , and that [I]0-i was quite [a philosopher]845-a philosopher . [We]840-we are all vain at times , and [I]0-i must confess [I]0-i felt flattered by [Carrie]73-carrie 's little compliment . [I]0-i do n't pretend to be able to express [myself]0-i in fine language , but [I]0-i feel [I]0-i have the power of expressing [my]0-i thoughts with simplicity and lucidness . About nine o'clock , to [our]840-we surprise , [Lupin]79-lupin entered , with a wild , reckless look , and in a hollow voice , which [I]0-i must say seemed rather theatrical , said : " Have [you]79-lupin any brandy ? "[79-lupin] [I]0-i said : " No ; but here is some whisky . "[0-i] [Lupin]79-lupin drank off nearly a wineglassful without water , to [my]0-i horror . November 22.-Gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings dropped in during the evening . November 24.-I went to [town]339-town without a pocket - handkerchief . This is the second time [I]0-i have done this during the last week . [I]0-i must be losing [my]0-i memory . November 25.-Had a long letter from [Mr. Fosselton]181-mr. burwin - fosselton respecting last night 's Irving discussion . [I]0-i was very angry , and [I]0-i wrote and said [I]0-i knew little or nothing about stage matters , was not in the least interested in [them]872-them and positively declined to be drawn into a discussion on the subject , even at the risk of its leading to a breach of friendship . [I]0-i never wrote a more determined letter . On returning [home]287-home at the usual early hour on Saturday afternoon [I]0-i met near the Archway [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar . [My]0-i heart gave a leap . [I]0-i bowed rather stiffly , but [she]151-daisy mutlar affected not to have seen [me]0-i . "[76-gowing] [The laundress]874-the laundress giggled like [an idiot]881-an idiot . [I]0-i was disgusted and walked [upstairs]361-upstairs for the purpose of pinning down [my]0-i collar , as the button had come off the back of [my]0-i shirt . [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i am losing [my]0-i sense of humour . [I]0-i spoke [my]0-i mind pretty freely about [Padge]180-mr. padge . The remainder of the night was [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar - [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar - [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar . Oh dear ! November 26 , [Sunday.-The curate]886-sunday.-the curate preached a very good sermon to - day - very good indeed . [His]886-sunday.-the curate appearance is never so impressive as [[our]887-our dear old vicar]888-our dear old vicar 's , but [I]0-i am bound to say [his]886-sunday.-the curate sermons are much more impressive . A rather annoying incident occurred , of which [I]0-i must make mention . [Mrs. Fernlosse]186-mrs. fernlosse , who is quite a grand lady , living in [one of [those large houses in [the Camden Road]891-the camden road]890-those large houses in the camden road]889-one of those large houses in the camden road , stopped to speak to [me]0-i after [church]329-church , when [we]887-our were all coming out . [I]0-i must say [I]0-i felt flattered , for [she]186-mrs. fernlosse is thought a good deal of . [I]0-i suppose [she]186-mrs. fernlosse knew [me]0-i through seeing [me]0-i so often take round the plate , especially as [she]186-mrs. fernlosse always occupies the corner seat of the pew . [She]186-mrs. fernlosse is [a very influential lady]893-a very influential lady , and may have had something of the utmost importance to say , but , unfortunately , as [she]186-mrs. fernlosse commenced to speak a strong gust of wind came and blew [my]0-i hat off into the middle of [the road]894-the road . [I]0-i had to run after it , and had the greatest difficulty in recovering it . When [I]0-i had succeeded in doing , so [I]0-i found [Mrs. Fernlosse]186-mrs. fernlosse had walked on with [some swell friends]895-some swell friends , and [I]0-i felt [I]0-i could not well approach [her]186-mrs. fernlosse now , especially as [my]0-i hat was smothered with mud . [I]0-i can not say how disappointed [I]0-i felt . In the evening ( Sunday evening of all others ) [I]0-i found an impertinent note from [Mr. Burwin - Fosselton]181-mr. burwin - fosselton , which ran as follows : " [Dear Mr. Pooter,-Although]187-dear mr. pooter,-although [your]187-dear mr. pooter,-although junior by perhaps some twenty or thirty years - which is sufficient reason that [you]187-dear mr. pooter,-although ought to have a longer record of the things and ways in [this miniature of [a planet]1586-a planet]1585-this miniature of a planet - [I]181-mr. burwin - fosselton feel it is just within the bounds of possibility that the wheels of [your]187-dear mr. pooter,-although life do n't travel so quickly round as those of [the humble writer of these lines]1587-the humble writer of these lines . " Very well , then ! Permit [me]188-revenons à nos moutons , [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , to advise [you]187-dear mr. pooter,-although to accept the verb . sap . "[188-revenons à nos moutons] [Revenons à nos moutons]188-revenons à nos moutons . " [Our]1591-our lives run in different grooves . [I]0-i live for [MY]0-i ART - THE STAGE . But chaçun á [son gout]1594-son gout . "[0-i] [I]0-i have registered a vow to mount the steps of fame . [I]0-i may crawl , [I]0-i may slip , [I]0-i may even falter ( [we]896-we all are weak ) , but reach the top rung of the ladder [I]0-i will ! ! ! When there , [my]0-i voice shall be heard , for [I]0-i will shout to [the multitudes below]897-the multitudes below : ' Vici ! ' For the present [I]0-i am only [an amateur]898-an amateur , and [my]0-i work is unknown , forsooth , save to [a party of [friends]293-friends]899-a party of friends , with here and there [an enemy]901-an enemy . " But , [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , let [me]901-an enemy ask [you]109-mr. pooter , ' What is the difference between [the amateur]1595-the amateur and [the professional]1596-the professional ? ' "[901-an enemy] None ! ! ! " Stay ! Yes , there is a difference . [One]621-one is paid for doing what [the other]1598-the other does as skilfully for nothing ! "[901-an enemy] But [I]0-i will be paid , too ! For [I]0-i , contrary to the wishes of [[my]0-i family]902-my family and [friends]293-friends , have at last elected to adopt the stage as [my]0-i profession . And when the farce craze is over - and , mark [you]904-you , that will be soon - [I]0-i will make [my]0-i power known ; for [I]0-i feel - pardon [my]0-i apparent conceit - that there is [no living man who can play the hump - backed Richard]905-no living man who can play the hump - backed richard as [I]0-i feel and know [I]0-i can . " And [you]904-you will be the first to come round and bend [your]904-you head in submission . There are many matters [you]904-you may understand , but knowledge of the fine art of acting is to [you]904-you an unknown quantity . "[0-i] Pray let this discussion cease with this letter . [Vale]189-vale ! " [Yours]904-you truly , "[189-vale] [Burwin - Fosselton]181-mr. burwin - fosselton . " [I]181-mr. burwin - fosselton was disgusted . December 17 - As [I]907-your friend open [my]907-your friend scribbling diary [I]907-your friend find the words "[907-your friend] Oxford Michaelmas Term ends . "[0-i] Another thought that strikes [me]0-i is that [Gowing]76-gowing seldom calls in the evening , and [Cummings]75-cummings never does . [I]0-i fear [they]910-they do n't get on well with [Lupin]79-lupin . December 18.-Yesterday [I]0-i was in a retrospective vein - to - day it is prospective . [I]0-i see nothing but clouds , clouds , clouds . [Lupin]79-lupin is perfectly intolerable over the [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar business . [He]79-lupin wo n't say what is the cause of the breach . "[0-i] [Carrie]73-carrie said [I]0-i was quite [a philosopher]845-a philosopher ; but [Lupin]79-lupin , in a jeering tone , said : " If it had been written on larger paper , [Guv]175-guv . , [we]915-we might get a fair price from [a butterman]1611-a butterman for it . December 19.-The annual invitation came to spend Christmas with [[Carrie]73-carrie 's mother]914-carrie 's mother - the usual family festive gathering to which [we]915-we always look forward . [Lupin]79-lupin declined to go . [I]0-i was astounded , and expressed [my]0-i surprise and disgust . [Lupin]79-lupin then obliged [us]915-we with the following Radical speech : " [I]79-lupin hate a family gathering at Christmas . What does it mean ? Why [someone]311-someone says : ' Ah ! [we]915-we miss [poor Uncle James , who was [here]1613-here last year , ' and [we]915-we all]192-poor uncle james , who was here last year , ' and we all begin to snivel . [Someone else]1614-someone else says : ' It 's two years since poor [Aunt Liz]193-aunt liz used to sit in [that corner]1615-that corner . ' Then [we]915-we all begin to snivel again . Then [another gloomy relation]1616-another gloomy relation says : ' Ah ! [I]79-lupin wonder whose turn it will be next ? ' Then [we]915-we all snivel again , and proceed to eat and drink too much ; and [they]921-people , who seemed to take up the cards rather roughly , and , after a hurried glance at them , throw them down again do n't discover until [I]79-lupin get up that [we]915-we have been seated thirteen at dinner . "[79-lupin] December 20.-Went to [Smirksons]194-smirksons ' , [the drapers]916-the drapers , in [the Strand]917-the strand , who this year have turned out everything in [the shop]918-the shop and devoted [the whole place]919-the whole place to the sale of Christmas cards . [Shop]920-shop crowded with [people , who seemed to take up the cards rather roughly , and , after a hurried glance at them , throw them down again]921-people , who seemed to take up the cards rather roughly , and , after a hurried glance at them , throw them down again . [I]0-i remarked to one of [the young persons serving]922-the young persons serving , that carelessness appeared to be a disease with [some purchasers]923-some purchasers . The observation was scarcely out of [my]0-i mouth , when [my]0-i thick coat - sleeve caught against a large pile of expensive cards in boxes one on top of the other , and threw them down . [The manager]924-the manager came forward , looking very much annoyed , and picking up several cards from the ground , said to [one of [the assistants]926-the assistants]925-one of the assistants , with a palpable side - glance at [me]0-i : " Put these amongst the sixpenny goods ; they ca n't be sold for a shilling now . "[924-the manager] The result was , [I]0-i felt it [my]0-i duty to buy some of these damaged cards . [I]0-i had to buy more and pay more than [I]0-i intended . "[928-a fat nurse with two babies] [I]0-i tore up the card and threw it away . December 21.-To save [the postmen]933-the postmen a miserable Christmas , [we]931-we follow the example of [all unselfish people]934-all unselfish people , and send out [our]931-we cards early . Most of the cards had finger - marks , which [I]0-i did not notice at night . [I]0-i shall buy all future cards in the daytime . [Lupin]79-lupin ( who , ever since [he]79-lupin has had the appointment with [a stock and share broker]935-a stock and share broker , does not seem over - scrupulous in [his]79-lupin dealings ) told [me]0-i never to rub out the pencilled price on the backs of the cards . Christmas [Day.-We]197-day.-we caught [the 10.20 train]949-the 10.20 train at [Paddington]37-paddington , and spent a pleasant day at [[Carrie]73-carrie 's mother]914-carrie 's mother 's . [The country]443-the country was quite nice and pleasant , although [the roads]952-the roads were sloppy . [We]953-we dined in the middle of the day , [just ten of [us]953-we]954-just ten of us , and talked over old times . If [everybody]681-everybody had [a nice , uninterfering mother]956-a nice , uninterfering mother - in - law , such as [I]0-i have , what a deal of happiness there would be in [the world]389-the world . Being all in good spirits , [I]0-i proposed [her]73-carrie health ; and [I]0-i made , [I]0-i think , a very good speech . [I]0-i concluded , rather neatly , by saying : " On an occasion like this - whether [relatives]1624-relatives , [friends]293-friends , or [acquaintances,-we]1626-acquaintances,-we are all inspired with good feelings towards [each other]530-each other . [We]1628-we are of one mind , and think only of love and friendship . [Those who have quarrelled with [absent friends]1630-absent friends]1629-those who have quarrelled with absent friends should kiss and make it up . [Those who happily have not fallen out]1631-those who happily have not fallen out , can kiss all the same . "[0-i] [I]0-i saw the tears in the eyes of both [Carrie]73-carrie and [[her]73-carrie mother]958-her mother , and must say [I]0-i felt very flattered by the compliment . That [dear old Reverend [John Panzy Smith]170-john , who married [us]959-us]170-john , made a most cheerful and amusing speech , and said [he]170-john should act on [my]0-i suggestion respecting the kissing . [He]170-john then walked round the table and kissed [all the ladies]960-all the ladies , including [Carrie]73-carrie . Of course [one]621-one did not object to this ; but [I]0-i was more than staggered when [a young fellow named [Moss]195-a mr. moss , who was a stranger to [me]0-i]962-a young fellow named moss , who was a stranger to me , and [who had scarcely spoken a word through dinner]963-who had scarcely spoken a word through dinner , jumped up suddenly with a sprig of mistletoe , and exclaimed : " Hulloh ! "[73-carrie] December 26.-I did not sleep very well last night ; [I]0-i never do in a strange bed . [I]0-i feel a little indigestion , which one must expect at this time of the year . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i returned to [Town]339-town in the evening . [Lupin]79-lupin came in late . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i have long since given up trying to understand [Lupin]79-lupin 's slang , or asking [him]79-lupin to explain it . [December]198-december 27.-I told [Lupin]79-lupin [I]0-i was expecting [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings to drop in to - morrow evening for a quiet game . [Carrie]73-carrie , who had listened to the above conversation with apparent annoyance , directed a well - aimed shaft at [Lupin]79-lupin . "[73-carrie] [Lupin]79-lupin was dumbfounded , and could make no reply . When [he]79-lupin left [the room]410-the room , [I]0-i gave [Carrie]73-carrie a kiss of approval . December 28.-Lupin , on coming down to breakfast , said to [[his]79-lupin mother]757-his mother : " [I]0-i have not put off [Daisy]151-daisy mutlar and [Frank]161-frank , and should like [them]1635-your father 's friends to join [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings this evening . "[0-i] [I]0-i felt very pleased with [the boy]363-the boy for this . [Carrie]73-carrie said , in reply : " [I]73-carrie am glad [you]79-lupin let [me]73-carrie know in time , as [I]73-carrie can turn over the cold leg of mutton , dress it with a little parsley , and [no one]1450-no one will know it has been cut . "[73-carrie] [She]73-carrie further said [she]73-carrie would make a few custards , and stew some pippins , so that they would be cold by the evening . Finding [Lupin]79-lupin in good spirits , [I]0-i asked [him]79-lupin quietly if [he]79-lupin really had any personal objection to either [Gowing]76-gowing or [Cummings]75-cummings . [He]79-lupin replied : " Not in the least . [I]79-lupin think [Cummings]75-cummings looks rather an ass , but that is partly due to [his]79-lupin patronising ' [the three - and - six - one - price hat company]1637-the three - and - six - one - price hat company , ' and wearing a reach - [me]79-lupin - down frock - coat . As for that perpetual brown velveteen jacket of [Gowing's]199-gowing's - why , [he]79-lupin resembles [an itinerant photographer]1638-an itinerant photographer . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i said it was not the coat that made [the gentleman]544-the gentleman ; whereupon [Lupin]79-lupin , with a laugh , replied : " No , and it was n't much of [a gentleman who made [their]544-the gentleman coats]1639-a gentleman who made their coats . "[79-lupin] [We]976-we were rather jolly at supper , and [Daisy]151-daisy mutlar made [herself]151-daisy mutlar very agreeable , especially in the earlier part of the evening , when [she]151-daisy mutlar sang . At supper , however , [she]151-daisy mutlar said : " Can [you]0-i make tee - to - tums with bread ? "[151-daisy mutlar] and [she]151-daisy mutlar commenced rolling up pieces of bread , and twisting them round on the table . [I]0-i felt this to be bad manners , but of course said nothing . [Presently Daisy]200-daisy and [Lupin]79-lupin , to [my]0-i disgust , began throwing bread - pills at each other . [Frank]161-frank followed suit , and so did [Cummings]75-cummings and [Gowing]76-gowing , to [my]0-i astonishment . [They]977-they then commenced throwing hard pieces of crust , one piece catching [me]0-i on the forehead , and making [me]0-i blink . [I]0-i said : " Steady , please ; steady ! "[0-i] [Frank]161-frank jumped up , and said : " Tum , tum ; then [the band]1640-the band played . "[161-frank] [I]0-i did not know what this meant , but [they]977-they all roared , and continued the bread - battle . [Gowing]76-gowing suddenly seized all the parsley off the cold mutton , and threw it full in [my]0-i face . [I]0-i looked daggers at [Gowing]76-gowing , who replied : " [I]76-gowing say , it 's no good trying to look indignant , with [your]0-i hair full of parsley . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i rose from the table , and insisted that a stop should be put to this foolery at once . [Frank Mutlar]161-frank shouted : " Time , [gentlemen]1641-gentlemen , please ! time ! "[161-frank] and turned out the gas , leaving [us]978-us in absolute darkness . [I]0-i was feeling [my]0-i way out of [the room]410-the room , when [I]0-i suddenly received a hard intentional punch at the back of [my]0-i head . [I]0-i said , loudly : " Who did that ? "[0-i] There was no answer ; so [I]0-i repeated the question , with the same result . [I]0-i struck a match , and lighted the gas . [They]977-they were all talking and laughing , so [I]0-i kept [my]0-i own counsel ; but , after [they]977-they had gone , [I]0-i said to [Carrie]73-carrie : " [The person who sent [me]0-i that insulting post - card at Christmas]1642-the person who sent me that insulting post - card at christmas was here to - night . "[0-i]

December 29.-I had a most vivid dream last night . [I]0-i woke up , and on falling asleep , dreamed the same dream over again precisely . [I]0-i dreamt [I]0-i heard [Frank Mutlar]161-frank telling [[his]161-frank sister]745-his sister that [he]161-frank had not only sent [me]0-i the insulting Christmas card , but admitted that [he]161-frank was [the one who punched [my]0-i head last night in the dark]981-the one who punched my head last night in the dark . [I]0-i detected a similarity in the writing , in spite of the attempted disguise . [I]0-i passed them on to [Carrie]73-carrie , who began to laugh . "[79-lupin] In the evening [Gowing]76-gowing called , and said [he]76-gowing enjoyed [himself]76-gowing very much last night . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i told [him]76-gowing [I]0-i felt hurt , in both senses of the expression . December 30 , [Sunday.-Lupin]202-sunday.-lupin spent the whole day with [the Mutlars]178-the mutlars . [He]79-lupin seemed rather cheerful in the evening , so [I]0-i said : " [I]0-i 'm glad to see [you]79-lupin so happy , [Lupin]79-lupin . [I]0-i received an extraordinary letter from [Mr. Mutlar]196-mr. mutlar , [senior]939-senior . [He]196-mr. mutlar writes : " Dear Sir,-For a long time past , [I]196-mr. mutlar have had considerable difficulty deciding the important question , ' Who is [the master of [[my]196-mr. mutlar own house]1651-my own house]1650-the master of my own house ? [Myself]196-mr. mutlar , or [[your]196-mr. mutlar son]1652-your son [Lupin]79-lupin ? ' Believe [me]196-mr. mutlar , [I]196-mr. mutlar have no prejudice one way or the other ; but [I]196-mr. mutlar have been most reluctantly compelled to give judgment to the effect that [I]196-mr. mutlar am [the master of it]1653-the master of it . Under the circumstances , it has become [my]196-mr. mutlar duty to forbid [[your]196-mr. mutlar son]1652-your son to enter [[my]196-mr. mutlar house]1513-my house again . [I]196-mr. mutlar am sorry , because it deprives [me]196-mr. mutlar of the society of [one of the most modest , unassuming , and gentlemanly persons [I]196-mr. mutlar have ever had the honour of being acquainted with]1656-one of the most modest , unassuming , and gentlemanly persons i have ever had the honour of being acquainted with . "[196-mr. mutlar] [I]0-i did not desire the last day to wind up disagreeably , so [I]0-i said nothing to either [Carrie]73-carrie or [Lupin]79-lupin about the letter . A most terrible fog came on , and [Lupin]79-lupin would go out in it , but promised to be back to drink out the Old Year - a custom [we]984-we have always observed . At a quarter to twelve [Lupin]79-lupin had not returned , and the fog was fearful . As time was drawing close , [I]0-i got out the spirits . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i deciding on whisky , [I]0-i opened a fresh bottle ; but [Carrie]73-carrie said it smelt like brandy . As [I]0-i knew it to be whisky , [I]0-i said there was nothing to discuss . [Carrie]73-carrie , evidently vexed that [Lupin]79-lupin had not come in , did discuss it all the same , and wanted [me]0-i to have a small wager with [her]73-carrie to decide by the smell . [I]0-i said [I]0-i could decide it by the taste in a moment . A silly and unnecessary argument followed , the result of which was [we]984-we suddenly saw it was a quarter - past twelve , and , for the first time in [our]984-we married life , [we]984-we missed welcoming in the New Year . [Lupin]79-lupin got [home]287-home at a quarter - past two , having got lost in the fog - so [he]79-lupin said . Begin the year with an unexpected promotion at [the office]323-the office . [I]0-i make two good jokes . [I]0-i get an enormous rise in [my]0-i salary . [Lupin]79-lupin speculates successfully and starts a pony - trap . Have to speak to [Sarah]85-sarah . Extraordinary conduct of [Gowing]76-gowing 's . January 1 - [I]0-i had intended concluding [my]0-i diary last week ; but a most important event has happened , so [I]0-i shall continue for a little while longer on the fly - leaves attached to the end of [my]0-i last year 's diary . It had just struck half - past one , and [I]0-i was on the point of leaving [the office]323-the office to have [my]0-i dinner , when [I]0-i received a message that [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp desired to see [me]0-i at once . [I]0-i must confess that [my]0-i heart commenced to beat and [I]0-i had most serious misgivings .

[Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp was in [[his]88-mr. perkupp room]706-his room writing , and [he]88-mr. perkupp said : " Take a seat , [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , [I]88-mr. perkupp shall not be a moment . "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i replied : " No , thank [you]88-mr. perkupp , [sir]1428-sir ; [I]0-i 'll stand . "[0-i] [I]0-i watched the clock on the mantelpiece , and [I]0-i was waiting quite twenty minutes ; but it seemed hours . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp at last got up [himself]88-mr. perkupp . "[88-mr. perkupp] What a weight off [my]0-i mind ! [My]0-i breath seemed to come back again in an instant . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp said : " [Mr. Buckling]90-buckling is going to retire , and there will be some slight changes in [the office]323-the office . [I]88-mr. perkupp have an appointment at two ; but [you]0-i shall hear more to - morrow . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i added : " Yes , and at last [you]0-i shall have that little costume which [you]0-i saw at [Peter Robinson]203-peter robinson 's so cheap . "[0-i] January 2.-I was in a great state of suspense all day at [the office]323-the office . "[88-mr. perkupp] January 3.-Still in a state of anxiety and excitement , which was not alleviated by ascertaining that [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp sent word [he]88-mr. perkupp should not be at [the office]323-the office at all to - day . "[79-lupin] January 5.-I can scarcely write the news . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp told [me]0-i [my]0-i salary would be raised £ 100 ! [I]0-i stood gaping for a moment unable to realise it . January 21.-I am very much concerned at [Lupin]79-lupin having started a pony - trap . [I]0-i said : " [Lupin]79-lupin , are [you]79-lupin justified in this outrageous extravagance ? "[0-i] [Lupin]79-lupin replied : " Well , [one]621-one must get to [the City]286-the city somehow . [I]79-lupin 've only hired [it]621-one , and can give it up any time [I]79-lupin like . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i repeated [my]0-i question : " Are [you]79-lupin justified in this extravagance ? "[0-i] [He]79-lupin replied : " Look here , [Guv]175-guv . ; excuse [my]79-lupin saying so , but [you]175-guv 're a bit out of date . [It]1685-it does not pay nowadays , fiddling about over small things . [I]79-lupin do n't mean anything personal , [Guv'nor]135-guv'nor . [[My]79-lupin boss]1686-my boss says if [I]79-lupin take [his]1686-my boss tip , and stick to big things , [I]79-lupin can make big money ! "[79-lupin] [I]0-i said [I]0-i thought the very idea of speculation most horrifying . [Lupin]79-lupin said : " It is not speculation , it 's a dead cert . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i advised [him]79-lupin , at all events , not to continue the pony and cart ; but [he]79-lupin replied : " [I]79-lupin made £ 200 in one day ; now suppose [I]79-lupin only make £ 200 in a month , or put it at £ 100 a month , which is ridiculously low - why , that is £ 1250 a year . What 's a few pounds a week for a trap ? "[79-lupin] [I]0-i did not pursue the subject further , beyond saying that [I]0-i should feel glad when the autumn came , and [Lupin]79-lupin would be of age and responsible for [his]79-lupin own debts . [He]79-lupin answered : " [[My]79-lupin dear]275-my dear [Guv]175-guv . , [I]79-lupin promise [you]175-guv faithfully that [I]79-lupin will never speculate with what [I]79-lupin have not got . [I]79-lupin shall only go on [Job Cleanands]207-job cleanands ' tips , and as [he]76-gowing is in the ' know ' it is pretty safe sailing . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i felt somewhat relieved . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i said [we]999-us should be delighted . January 22.-I do n't generally lose [my]0-i temper with [servants]1001-servants ; but [I]0-i had to speak to [Sarah]85-sarah rather sharply about a careless habit [she]85-sarah has recently contracted of shaking the table - cloth , after removing the breakfast things , in a manner which causes all the crumbs to fall on the carpet , eventually to be trodden in . [Sarah]85-sarah answered very rudely : " Oh , [you]0-i are always complaining . "[85-sarah] [I]0-i replied : " Indeed , [I]0-i am not . "[0-i] [She]85-sarah said : " And [you]0-i 're always grumbling about [your]0-i breakfast . "[85-sarah] [I]0-i said : " No , [I]0-i am not , but [I]0-i feel perfectly justified in complaining that [I]0-i never can get a hard - boiled egg . "[0-i] [She]85-sarah began to cry and make a scene ; but fortunately [my]0-i ' bus came by , so [I]0-i had a good excuse for leaving [her]85-sarah . [Gowing]76-gowing left a message in the evening , that [we]1002-we were not to forget next Saturday . [Carrie]73-carrie amusingly said : " As [he]76-gowing has never asked [any friends]1688-any friends before , [we]1002-we are not likely to forget it . "[73-carrie] [January]208-january 23.-I asked [Lupin]79-lupin to try and change the hard brushes , [he]79-lupin recently made [me]0-i a present of , for some softer ones , as [[my]0-i hairdresser]1003-my hairdresser tells [me]0-i [I]0-i ought not to brush [my]0-i hair too much just now . [January 25.-We]208-january had just finished [our]1002-we tea , when who should come in but [Cummings]75-cummings , who has not been [here]1613-here for over three weeks . "[0-i] [He]1008-he replied : " Yes ! and [I]1008-he feel blue too . "[1008-he] [I]0-i said : " Why , what 's the matter ? "[76-gowing] [January]208-january 26.-An extraordinary thing happened . [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i went round to [Gowing]76-gowing 's , as arranged , at half - past seven . [We]1010-we knocked and rang several times without getting an answer . At last the latch was drawn and the door opened a little way , the chain still being up . [A man in shirt - sleeves]1011-a man in shirt - sleeves put [his]1011-a man in shirt - sleeves head through and said : " Who is it ? What do [you]0-i want ? "[1011-a man in shirt - sleeves] [I]0-i said : " [Mr. Gowing]76-gowing , [he]76-gowing is expecting [us]1010-we . "[435-the man] [The man]435-the man said ( as well as [I]0-i could hear , owing to the yapping of a little dog ): " [I]0-i do n't think [he]76-gowing is . "[0-i] With that observation [he]435-the man slammed the door , leaving [Carrie]73-carrie and [me]0-i standing on the steps with a cutting wind blowing round the corner . [Carrie]73-carrie advised [me]0-i to knock again . [I]0-i did so , and then discovered for the first time that the knocker had been newly painted , and the paint had come off on [my]0-i gloves - which were , in consequence , completely spoiled . [I]0-i knocked at the door with [my]0-i stick two or three times . [The man]435-the man opened the door , taking the chain off this time , and began abusing [me]0-i . "[435-the man] The impertinence of [this man]1014-this man was nothing . [I]0-i scarcely noticed it , it was so trivial in comparison with the scandalous conduct of [Gowing]76-gowing . February 9.-Exactly a fortnight has passed , and [I]0-i have neither seen nor heard from [Gowing]76-gowing respecting [his]76-gowing extraordinary conduct in asking [us]1017-us round to [[his]76-gowing house]1018-his house , and then being out . February 10 , Sunday.-Contrary to [my]0-i wishes , [Carrie]73-carrie allowed [Lupin]79-lupin to persuade [her]73-carrie to take [her]73-carrie for a drive in the afternoon in [[his]79-lupin trap]1021-his trap . "[79-lupin] [Lupin]79-lupin proceeded to put on a bright - blue coat that seemed miles too large for [him]79-lupin . [Carrie]73-carrie said it wanted taking in considerably at the back . "[79-lupin] [He]79-lupin may wear what [he]79-lupin likes in the future , for [I]0-i shall never drive with [him]79-lupin again . [His]79-lupin conduct was shocking . [He]79-lupin shouted to [respectable people who were walking quietly in [the road]894-the road to get out of the way]1024-respectable people who were walking quietly in the road to get out of the way ; [he]79-lupin flicked at the horse of [an old man who was riding , causing it to rear]1026-an old man who was riding , causing it to rear ; and , as [I]0-i had to ride backwards , [I]0-i was compelled to face a gang of roughs in [a donkey - cart]1027-a donkey - cart , whom [Lupin]79-lupin had chaffed , and who turned and followed [us]1022-us for nearly a mile , bellowing , indulging in coarse jokes and laughter , to say nothing of occasionally pelting [us]1022-us with orange - peel . [Frank Mutlar]161-frank called in the evening , and [Lupin]79-lupin went out with [him]161-frank . February 18 - [Carrie]73-carrie has several times recently called attention to the thinness of [my]0-i hair at the top of [my]0-i head , and recommended [me]0-i to get it seen to . [I]0-i was this morning trying to look at it by the aid of a small hand - glass , when somehow [my]0-i elbow caught against the edge of the chest of drawers and knocked the glass out of [my]0-i hand and smashed it . [Carrie]73-carrie was in an awful way about it , as [she]73-carrie is rather absurdly superstitious . "[79-lupin] [February]212-february 19.-Lupin , before going to [town]339-town , said : " [I]799-the former am very sorry about those [Parachikka Chlorates]213-parachikka chlorates ; it would not have happened if [the boss]1726-the boss , [Job Cleanands]207-job cleanands , had been in [town]339-town . "[799-the former] [He]799-the former entered , and to the surprise of [Lupin]79-lupin and [myself]0-i , seemed to be in the very best of spirits . "[79-lupin] Before [I]0-i could reply , [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Well , [I]76-gowing lose nothing , fortunately . "[76-gowing] [Lupin]79-lupin burst out laughing , and , in the most unseemly manner , said : " Alas , [poor Cummings]75-cummings ! [He]79-lupin 'll lose £ 35 . "[79-lupin] At that moment there was a ring at the bell . [Lupin]79-lupin said : " [I]79-lupin do n't want to meet [Cummings]75-cummings . "[79-lupin] If [he]79-lupin had gone out of the door [he]79-lupin would have met [him]79-lupin in [the passage]687-the passage , so as quickly as possible [Lupin]79-lupin opened the parlour window and got out . [Gowing]76-gowing jumped up suddenly , exclaiming : " [I]76-gowing do n't want to see [him]79-lupin either ! "[76-gowing] and , before [I]0-i could say a word , [he]79-lupin followed [Lupin]79-lupin out of the window . For [my]0-i own part , [I]0-i was horrified to think [[my]0-i own son]1046-my own son and [one of [[my]0-i most intimate friends]1048-my most intimate friends]1047-one of my most intimate friends should depart from [the house]318-the house like [a couple of interrupted burglars]1050-a couple of interrupted burglars . [Poor Cummings]75-cummings was very upset , and of course was naturally very angry both with [Lupin]79-lupin and [Gowing]76-gowing . [I]0-i pressed [him]79-lupin to have a little whisky , and [he]79-lupin replied that [he]79-lupin had given up whisky ; but would like a little " Unsweetened , "[79-lupin] as [he]79-lupin was advised it was the most healthy spirit . [I]0-i had none in [the house]318-the house , but sent [Sarah]85-sarah round to [Lockwood 's]41-lockwood 's for some . February 20.-The first thing that caught [my]0-i eye on opening the Standard was-"Great Failure of [Stock and Share Dealers]1732-stock and share dealers ! [I]73-carrie never did think it a suitable situation for [him]79-lupin . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i thought the whole affair very shocking . "[79-lupin] [He]79-lupin then read a letter from [Frank Mutlar]161-frank , announcing , in a cool manner , that [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar is to be married next month to [Murray Posh]210-mr. posh . "[79-lupin] [We]1052-we all then ate [our]1052-we breakfast in dead silence . In fact , [I]0-i could eat nothing . [He]79-lupin replied : " Oh ! only a little consolation - still it is a consolation . "[79-lupin] Marriage of [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar and [Murray Posh]210-mr. posh . The dream of [my]0-i life realised . March 20 - To - day being the day on which [Daisy Mutlar]151-daisy mutlar and [Mr. Murray Posh]210-mr. posh are to be married , [Lupin]79-lupin has gone with [a friend]417-a friend to spend the day at [Gravesend]43-gravesend . [Lupin]79-lupin has been much cut - up over the affair , although [he]79-lupin declares that [he]79-lupin is glad it is off . [I]0-i wish [he]79-lupin would not go to so many music - halls , but [one]621-one dare not say anything to [him]79-lupin about it . At the present moment [he]79-lupin irritates [me]0-i by singing all over [the house]318-the house some nonsense about " What 's the matter with [Gladstone]120-mr. gladstone ? [He]120-mr. gladstone 's all right ! What 's the matter with [Lupin]79-lupin ? [He]79-lupin 's all right ! "[79-lupin] [I]0-i do n't think either of [them]1057-them is . "[76-gowing] [Carrie]73-carrie very properly resented this , and [Gowing]76-gowing had sufficient sense to say [he]76-gowing was sorry .

March 21.-To - day [I]0-i should conclude [my]0-i diary , for it is one of the happiest days of [my]0-i life . [My]0-i great dream of the last few weeks - in fact , of many years - has been realised . This morning came a letter from [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , asking [me]0-i to take [Lupin]79-lupin down to [the office]323-the office with [me]0-i . [I]0-i went to [[Lupin]79-lupin 's room]707-lupin 's room ; poor fellow , [he]79-lupin seemed very pale , and said [he]79-lupin had a bad headache . [He]79-lupin had come back yesterday from [Gravesend]43-gravesend , where [he]79-lupin spent part of the day in [a small boat on]1060-a small boat on [the water]1061-the water , having been mad enough to neglect to take [his]79-lupin overcoat with [him]79-lupin . [I]0-i showed [him]79-lupin [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp 's letter , and [he]79-lupin got up as quickly as possible . [I]0-i begged of [him]79-lupin not to put on [his]79-lupin fast - coloured clothes and ties , but to dress in something black or quiet - looking . [Carrie]73-carrie was all of a tremble when [she]73-carrie read the letter , and all [she]73-carrie could keep on saying was : " Oh , [I]73-carrie do hope it will be all right . "[73-carrie] For [myself]0-i , [I]0-i could scarcely eat any breakfast . [Lupin]79-lupin came down dressed quietly , and looking [a perfect gentleman]1062-a perfect gentleman , except that [his]79-lupin face was rather yellow . [Carrie]73-carrie , by way of encouragement , said : " [You]79-lupin do look nice , [Lupin]79-lupin . "[73-carrie] [Lupin]79-lupin replied : " Yes , it 's a good make - up , is n't it ? [A regular - downright - respectable - funereal - first - class - City - firm - junior - clerk]1737-a regular - downright - respectable - funereal - first - class - city - firm - junior - clerk . "[79-lupin] [He]79-lupin laughed rather ironically . In [the hall]701-the hall [I]0-i heard a great noise , and also [Lupin]79-lupin shouting to [Sarah]85-sarah to fetch down [his]79-lupin old hat . [I]0-i went into [the passage]687-the passage , and found [Lupin]79-lupin in a fury , kicking and smashing a new tall hat . It seemed hours before [we]1065-we reached [the office]323-the office . [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp sent for [Lupin]79-lupin , who was with [him]88-mr. perkupp nearly an hour . "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i said : " [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , may [I]0-i go [home]287-home ? [I]0-i can not work any more to - day . An odd invitation to [Southend]45-southend . April 8 - No events of any importance , except that [Gowing]76-gowing strongly recommended a new patent stylographic pen , which cost [me]0-i nine - and - sixpence , and which was simply nine - and - sixpence thrown in the mud . It has caused [me]0-i constant annoyance and irritability of temper . The ink oozes out of the top , making a mess on [my]0-i hands , and once at [the office]323-the office when [I]0-i was knocking the palm of [my]0-i hand on the desk to jerk the ink down , [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , who had just entered , called out : " Stop that knocking ! [I]88-mr. perkupp suppose that is [you]0-i , [Mr. Pitt]89-pitt ? "[88-mr. perkupp] [That young monkey]1087-that young monkey , [Pitt]89-pitt , took a malicious glee in responding quite loudly : " No , [sir]1428-sir ; [I]89-pitt beg pardon , it is [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter with [his]109-mr. pooter pen ; it has been going on all the morning . "[89-pitt] To make matters worse , [I]0-i saw [Lupin]79-lupin laughing behind [his]79-lupin desk . [I]0-i thought it wiser to say nothing . [I]0-i took the pen back to [the shop]918-the shop and asked [them]918-the shop if [they]918-the shop would take it back , as it did not act . [I]0-i did not expect the full price returned , but was willing to take half . [The man]435-the man said [he]435-the man could not do that - buying and selling were two different things . [Lupin]79-lupin 's conduct during the period [he]79-lupin has been in [[Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp 's office]1090-mr. perkupp 's office has been most exemplary . [My]0-i only fear is , it is too good to last . [April 9.-Gowing]83-april called , bringing with [him]88-mr. perkupp an invitation for [Carrie]73-carrie and [myself]0-i to a ball given by [the East Acton Rifle Brigade]1091-the east acton rifle brigade , which [he]88-mr. perkupp thought would be a swell affair , as [the member for [East Acton]44-east acton]1092-the member for east acton ( [Sir William Grime]217-sir william grime ) had promised [his]88-mr. perkupp patronage . [We]1093-we accepted of [his]88-mr. perkupp kindness , and [he]88-mr. perkupp stayed to supper , an occasion [I]0-i thought suitable for trying a bottle of the sparkling Algéra that [Mr. James]97-mr. james ( of [Sutton]12-sutton ) had sent as a present . [Gowing]76-gowing sipped the wine , observing that [he]76-gowing had never tasted it before , and further remarked that [his]76-gowing policy was to stick to more recognised brands . [I]0-i told [him]76-gowing it was a present from [a dear friend]1094-a dear friend , and one must n't look a gift - horse in the mouth . [Gowing]76-gowing facetiously replied : " And [he]76-gowing did n't like putting it in the mouth either . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i thought the remarks were rude without being funny , but on tasting it [myself]0-i , came to the conclusion there was some justification for them . The sparkling Algéra is very like cider , only more sour . [I]0-i suggested that perhaps the thunder had turned it a bit acid . [He]76-gowing merely replied : " Oh ! [I]76-gowing do n't think so . "[76-gowing] [We]1093-we had a very pleasant game of cards , though [I]0-i lost four shillings and [Carrie]73-carrie lost one , and [Gowing]76-gowing said [he]76-gowing had lost about sixpence : how [he]76-gowing could have lost , considering that [Carrie]73-carrie and [I]0-i were [the only other players]1095-the only other players , remains a mystery . April 14 , Sunday.-Owing , [I]0-i presume , to the unsettled weather , [I]0-i awoke with a feeling that [my]0-i skin was drawn over [my]0-i face as tight as a drum . April 15.-Burnt [my]0-i tongue most awfully with the Worcester sauce , through [that stupid girl]1103-that stupid girl [Sarah]85-sarah shaking the bottle violently before putting it on the table .

April 16.-The night of the East Acton Volunteer Ball . On [my]0-i advice , [Carrie]73-carrie put on the same dress that [she]73-carrie looked so beautiful in at [the Mansion House]473-the mansion house , for it had occurred to [me]0-i , being a military ball , that [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , who , [I]0-i believe , is [an officer in [the Honourary Artillery Company]1106-the honourary artillery company]1105-an officer in the honourary artillery company , would in all probability be present . [Lupin]79-lupin , in [his]79-lupin usual incompre­hensible language , remarked that [he]79-lupin had heard it was a " bounders ' ball . "[79-lupin] [I]0-i did n't ask [him]79-lupin what [he]79-lupin meant though [I]0-i did n't understand . Where [he]79-lupin gets these expressions from [I]0-i do n't know ; [he]79-lupin certainly does n't learn them at [home]287-home . The invitation was for half - past eight , so [I]0-i concluded if [we]1108-we arrived an hour later [we]1108-we should be in good time , without being " unfashionable , "[94-mrs. james] as [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james says . It was very difficult to find - [the cabman]1109-the cabman having to get down several times to inquire at [different public - houses where [the Drill Hall]1111-the drill hall was]1110-different public - houses where the drill hall was . [Captain Welcut]219-captain welcut received [us]1108-we , saying [we]1108-we were rather late , but that it was better late than never . "[73-carrie] [He]219-captain welcut begged to be excused for leaving [us]1108-we , as [he]219-captain welcut was engaged for a dance , and hoped [we]1108-we should make [ourselves]1108-we at [home]287-home . [Carrie]73-carrie took [my]0-i arm and [we]1108-we walked round [the rooms]1694-the rooms two or three times and watched [the people]609-the people dancing . [Mr. Padge]180-mr. padge is a man that , [I]0-i admit , [I]0-i have no particular liking for , but [I]0-i felt so glad to come across [some one [I]0-i knew]1126-some one i knew , that [I]0-i asked [him]180-mr. padge to sit at [our]1127-we table , and [I]0-i must say that for [a short fat man]1128-a short fat man [he]180-mr. padge looked well in uniform , although [I]0-i think [his]180-mr. padge tunic was rather baggy in the back . "[1640-the band] [The band]1640-the band struck up for the dance , and [they]1640-the band all went into [the ball - room]1142-the ball - room . [The ladies]439-the ladies ( [Carrie]73-carrie and [Mrs. Lupkin]220-mrs. lupkin ) were anxious to see the dancing , and as [I]0-i had not quite finished [my]0-i supper , [Mr. Padge]180-mr. padge offered [his]180-mr. padge arms to [them]439-the ladies and escorted [them]439-the ladies to [the ball - room]1142-the ball - room , telling [me]0-i to follow . "[180-mr. padge] When [I]0-i had quite finished [my]0-i supper , and was leaving , [the waiter who had been attending on [us]1146-us]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us arrested [my]0-i attention by tapping [me]0-i on the shoulder . [I]0-i thought it unusual for [a waiter at a private ball]1147-a waiter at a private ball to expect a tip , but nevertheless gave a shilling , as [he]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us had been very attentive . [He]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us smilingly replied : " [I]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us beg [your]0-i pardon , [sir]1428-sir , this is no good , "[1145-the waiter who had been attending on us] alluding to the shilling . " [[Your]0-i party]1751-your party 's had four suppers at 5s . a head , five ices at 1s . , three bottles of champagne at 11s . 6d . , a glass of claret , and a sixpenny cigar for [the stout gentleman]1752-the stout gentleman - in all £ 3 0s . 6d . ! "[1145-the waiter who had been attending on us] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i was ever so surprised in [my]0-i life , and had only sufficient breath to inform [him]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us that [I]0-i had received a private invitation , to which [he]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us answered that [he]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us was perfectly well aware of that ; but that the invitation did n't include eatables and drinkables . [A gentleman who was standing at the bar]1148-a gentleman who was standing at the bar corroborated [the waiter]794-the waiter 's statement , and assured [me]0-i it was quite correct . [The waiter]794-the waiter said [he]794-the waiter was extremely sorry if [I]0-i had been under any misappre­hension ; but it was not [his]794-the waiter fault . Of course there was nothing to be done but to pay . So , after turning out [my]0-i pockets , [I]0-i just managed to scrape up sufficient , all but nine shillings ; but [the manager]924-the manager , on [my]0-i giving [my]0-i card to [him]1145-the waiter who had been attending on us , said : " That 's all right . "[924-the manager] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i ever felt more humiliated in [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i determined to keep this misfortune from [Carrie]73-carrie , for it would entirely destroy the pleasant evening [she]73-carrie was enjoying . [I]0-i felt there was no more enjoyment for [me]0-i that evening , and it being late , [I]0-i sought [Carrie]73-carrie and [Mrs. Lupkin]220-mrs. lupkin . [Carrie]73-carrie said [she]73-carrie was quite ready to go , and [Mrs. Lupkin]220-mrs. lupkin , as [we]1152-we were wishing [her]73-carrie " Good - night , "[220-mrs. lupkin] asked [Carrie]73-carrie and [myself]0-i if [we]1152-we ever paid a visit to [Southend]45-southend ? On [my]0-i replying that [I]0-i had n't been [there]1525-there for many years , [she]220-mrs. lupkin very kindly said : " Well , why do n't [you]0-i come down and stay at [[our]1152-we place]1753-our place ? "[220-mrs. lupkin] As [her]220-mrs. lupkin invitation was so pressing , and observing that [Carrie]73-carrie wished to go , [we]1152-we promised [we]1152-we would visit [her]73-carrie the next Saturday week , and stay till Monday . [Mrs. Lupkin]220-mrs. lupkin said [she]220-mrs. lupkin would write to [us]1152-we to - morrow , giving [us]1152-we the address and particulars of [trains]1154-trains , etc . When [we]1152-we got outside [the Drill Hall]1111-the drill hall it was raining so hard that [the roads]952-the roads resembled [canals]1157-canals , and [I]0-i need hardly say [we]1152-we had great difficulty in getting [a cabman]1085-a cabman to take [us]1152-we to [Holloway]2-holloway . After waiting a bit , [a man]1462-a man said [he]1462-a man would drive [us]1152-we , anyhow , as far as " [The Angel]46-the angel , "[1462-a man] at [Islington]17-islington , and [we]1152-we could easily get [another cab]1160-another cab from [there]1525-there . It was a tedious journey ; the rain was beating against the windows and trickling down the inside of [the cab]1488-the cab . When [we]1152-we arrived at " [The Angel]46-the angel "[73-carrie] the horse seemed tired out . [Carrie]73-carrie got out and ran into a doorway , and when [I]0-i came to pay , to [my]0-i absolute horror [I]0-i remembered [I]0-i had no money , nor had [Carrie]73-carrie . [I]0-i explained to [the cabman]1109-the cabman how [we]1152-we were situated . Never in [my]0-i life have [I]0-i ever been so insulted ; [the cabman]1109-the cabman , who was [a rough bully]1165-a rough bully and to [my]0-i thinking not sober , called [me]0-i every name [he]1109-the cabman could lay [his]1109-the cabman tongue to , and positively seized [me]0-i by the beard , which [he]1109-the cabman pulled till the tears came into [my]0-i eyes . [I]0-i took the number of [a policeman ( who witnessed the assault]1166-a policeman ( who witnessed the assault ) for not taking [the man in charge]1167-the man in charge . [The policeman]1168-the policeman said [he]1168-the policeman could n't interfere , that [he]1168-the policeman had seen no assault , and that [people]541-people should not ride in [cabs]1446-cabs without money . [We]1152-we had to walk [home]287-home in the pouring rain , nearly two miles , and when [I]0-i got in [I]0-i put down the conversation [I]0-i had with [the cabman]1109-the cabman , word for word , as [I]0-i intend writing to [the Telegraph]1173-the telegraph for the purpose of proposing that [cabs]1446-cabs should be driven only by [men under Government control]1175-men under government control , to prevent [civilians]1176-civilians being subjected to the disgraceful insult and outrage that [I]0-i had had to endure . April 18.-Water all right again in [the cistern]1178-the cistern . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , of [Sutton]12-sutton , called in the afternoon .
