[April]83-april 20.-Cummings called , hobbling in with a stick , saying [he]221-mr. griffin had been on [his]221-mr. griffin back for a week . It appears [he]221-mr. griffin was trying to shut [[his]221-mr. griffin bedroom]1184-his bedroom door , which is situated just at the top of the staircase , and unknown to [him]221-mr. griffin a piece of cork the dog had been playing with had got between the door , and prevented it shutting ; and in pulling the door hard , to give it an extra slam , the handle came off in [his]221-mr. griffin hands , and [he]221-mr. griffin fell backwards [downstairs]815-downstairs . On hearing this , [Lupin]79-lupin suddenly jumped up from the couch and rushed out of [the room]410-the room sideways . [Cummings]75-cummings looked very indignant , and remarked it was very poor fun [a man]1462-a man nearly breaking [his]221-mr. griffin back ; and though [I]0-i had [my]0-i suspicions that [Lupin]79-lupin was laughing , [I]0-i assured [Cummings]75-cummings that [he]221-mr. griffin had only run out to open the door to [a friend [he]221-mr. griffin expected]1188-a friend he expected . "[75-cummings] [April]83-april 22.-I have of late frequently noticed [Carrie]73-carrie rubbing [her]73-carrie nails a good deal with an instrument , and on asking [her]73-carrie what [she]73-carrie was doing , [she]73-carrie replied : " Oh , [I]73-carrie 'm going in for manicuring . A discussion on dreams . April 27 - Kept a little later than usual at [the office]323-the office , and as [I]0-i was hurrying along [a man]1462-a man stopped [me]0-i , saying : " Hulloh ! April 28 , [Sunday.-We]132-sunday.-we found [Watney Villa]55-watney villa further off than [we]1208-we anticipated , and only arrived as the clock struck two , both feeling hot and uncomfortable . To make matters worse , a large collie dog pounced forward to receive [us]1208-we . [He]1211-he barked loudly and jumped up at [Carrie]73-carrie , covering [her]73-carrie light skirt , which [she]73-carrie was wearing for the first time , with mud . [Teddy Finsworth]222-teddy came out and drove the dog off and apologised . [We]1208-we were shown into [the drawing - room]506-the drawing - room , which was beautifully decorated . [It]506-the drawing - room was full of knick - knacks , and some plates hung up on the wall . There were several little wooden milk - stools with paintings on them ; also a white wooden banjo , painted by one of [[Mr. Paul Finsworth]223-mr. finsworth 's nieces]1213-mr. paul finsworth 's nieces - [a cousin of [Teddy]222-teddy 's]1214-a cousin of teddy 's . [Mr. Paul Finsworth]223-mr. finsworth seemed quite [a distinguished - looking elderly gentleman]1215-a distinguished - looking elderly gentleman , and was most gallant to [Carrie]73-carrie . There were a great many water - colours hanging on the walls , mostly different views of [India]27-india , which were very bright . [Mr. Finsworth]223-mr. finsworth said they were painted by " [Simpz]224-simpz , "[223-mr. finsworth] and added that [he]223-mr. finsworth was [no judge of pictures]1216-no judge of pictures [himself]223-mr. finsworth but had been informed on good authority that they were worth some hundreds of pounds , although [he]223-mr. finsworth had only paid a few shillings apiece for them , frames included , at a sale in [the neighbourhood]1217-the neighbourhood . There was also a large picture in a very handsome frame , done in coloured crayons . It looked like a religious subject . [I]0-i was very much struck with the lace collar , it looked so real , but [I]0-i unfortunately made the remark that there was something about the expression of the face that was not quite pleasing . It looked pinched . [Mr. Finsworth]223-mr. finsworth sorrowfully replied : " Yes , the face was done after death - [[my]223-mr. finsworth wife]1695-my wife 's sister . "[223-mr. finsworth] [I]0-i felt terribly awkward and bowed apologetically , and in a whisper said [I]0-i hoped [I]0-i had not hurt [his]223-mr. finsworth feelings . [He]227-mr. short evidently did not see [my]0-i little joke , although [I]0-i repeated it twice with a little laugh . [I]0-i suddenly remembered it was Sunday , and [Mr. Short]227-mr. short was perhaps very particular .

In this [I]0-i was mistaken , for [he]227-mr. short was not at all particular in several of [his]227-mr. short remarks after dinner . Another thing that annoyed [me]0-i at dinner was that the collie dog , which jumped up at [Carrie]73-carrie , was allowed to remain under the dining - room table . [It]1222-it kept growling and snapping at [my]0-i boots every time [I]0-i moved [my]0-i foot . "[226-mrs. finsworth] [Mr. Finsworth]223-mr. finsworth had up some fine port , although [I]0-i question whether it is a good thing to take on the top of beer . [April]83-april 29.-I am getting quite accustomed to being snubbed by [Lupin]79-lupin , and [I]0-i do not mind being sat upon by [Carrie]73-carrie , because [I]0-i think [she]73-carrie has a certain amount of right to do so ; but [I]0-i do think it hard to be at once snubbed by [wife]1231-wife , [son]1232-son , and both [[my]0-i guests]1233-my guests . [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]75-cummings had dropped in during the evening , and [I]0-i suddenly remembered an extraordinary dream [I]0-i had a few nights ago , and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would tell [them]1233-my guests about it . [I]0-i dreamt [I]0-i saw some huge blocks of ice in [a shop]1234-a shop with a bright glare behind them . [I]0-i walked into [the shop]918-the shop and the heat was overpowering . [I]0-i found that the blocks of ice were on fire . The whole thing was so real and yet so supernatural [I]0-i woke up in a cold perspiration . [Lupin]79-lupin in a most contemptuous manner , said : " What utter rot . "[79-lupin] Before [I]0-i could reply , [Gowing]76-gowing said there was nothing so completely uninteresting as [other people]1236-other people 's dreams . [I]0-i appealed to [Cummings]75-cummings , but [he]1237-he said [he]1237-he was bound to agree with [the others]368-the others and [my]0-i dream was especially nonsensical . [I]0-i said : " It seemed so real to [me]0-i . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing replied : " Yes , to [you]75-cummings perhaps , but not to [us]368-the others . "[76-gowing] Whereupon [they]368-the others all roared . [Carrie]73-carrie , who had hitherto been quiet , said : " [He]1237-he tells [me]73-carrie [his]1237-he stupid dreams every morning nearly . "[73-carrie] [I]0-i replied : " Very well , [dear]1578-dear , [I]0-i promise [you]1578-dear [I]0-i will never tell [you]1578-dear or [anybody else]1766-anybody else another dream of [mine]0-i the longest day [I]0-i live . "[0-i] [Lupin]79-lupin said : " Hear ! hear ! "[79-lupin] and helped [himself]79-lupin to another glass of beer . The subject was fortunately changed , and [Cummings]75-cummings read a most interesting article on the superiority of the bicycle to the horse . Dinner at [Franching]108-franching 's to meet [Mr. Hardfur Huttle]229-mr. huttle . May 10 - Received a letter from [Franching]108-franching , of [Peckham]22-peckham , asking [us]1239-we to dine with [him]108-franching to - night , at seven o'clock , to meet [Mr. Hardfur Huttle]229-mr. huttle , [a very clever writer for the American papers]1240-a very clever writer for the american papers . [Franching]108-franching apologised for the short notice ; but said [he]108-franching had at the last moment been disappointed of [two of [[his]108-franching guests]1242-his guests]1241-two of his guests and regarded [us]1239-we as [old friends who would not mind filling up the gap]1243-old friends who would not mind filling up the gap . [Carrie]73-carrie rather demurred at the invitation ; but [I]0-i explained to [her]73-carrie that [Franching]108-franching was very well off and influential , and [we]1239-we could not afford to offend [him]108-franching . " And [we]1239-we are sure to get a good dinner and a good glass of champagne . "[0-i] " Which never agrees with [you]108-franching ! "[73-carrie] [Carrie]73-carrie replied , sharply . [I]0-i regarded [Carrie]73-carrie 's observation as unsaid . [Mr. Franching]108-franching asked [us]1239-we to wire a reply . As [he]108-franching had said nothing about dress in the letter , [I]0-i wired back : " With pleasure . Is it full dress ? "[0-i] and by leaving out [our]1239-we name , just got the message within the sixpence . Got back early to give time to dress , which [we]1239-we received a telegram instructing [us]1239-we to do . [I]0-i wanted [Carrie]73-carrie to meet [me]0-i at [[Franching]108-franching 's house]1244-franching 's house ; but [she]73-carrie would not do so , so [I]0-i had to go [home]287-home to fetch [her]73-carrie . What a long journey it is from [Holloway]2-holloway to [Peckham]22-peckham ! Why do [people]541-people live such a long way off ? Having to change ' buses , [I]0-i allowed plenty of time - in fact , too much ; for [we]1239-we arrived at twenty minutes to seven , and [Franching]108-franching , so [the servant]281-the servant said , had only just gone up to dress . However , [he]108-franching was down as the clock struck seven ; [he]108-franching must have dressed very quickly . [I]0-i must say it was quite a distinguished party , and although [we]1239-we did not know [anybody]1466-anybody personally , [they]1466-anybody all seemed to be quite swells . [Franching]108-franching had got [a professional waiter]1249-a professional waiter , and evidently spared no expense . There were flowers on the table round some fairy - lamps , and the effect , [I]0-i must say , was exquisite . The wine was good and there was plenty of champagne , concerning which [Franching]108-franching said [he]108-franching , [himself]108-franching , never wished to taste better . [We]1239-we were ten in number , and a menû card to each . [One lady]1250-one lady said [she]1250-one lady always preserved the menû and got [the guests]1251-the guests to write [their]1251-the guests names on the back . [[We]1239-we all of [us]1239-we]1252-we all of us followed [her]1250-one lady example , except [Mr. Huttle]229-mr. huttle , who was of course [the important guest]1253-the important guest . [Franching]108-franching said [he]108-franching was sorry [he]108-franching had [no lady]1257-no lady for [me]0-i to take in to dinner . [I]0-i sat next to [Mrs. Field]231-mrs. field at dinner , [she]231-mrs. field seemed [a well - informed lady]1258-a well - informed lady , but was very deaf . It did not much matter , for [Mr. Hardfur Huttle]229-mr. huttle did all the talking . [He]229-mr. huttle is [a marvellously intellectual man]1259-a marvellously intellectual man and says things which from [other people]1236-other people would seem quite alarming . How [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could remember even a quarter of [his]229-mr. huttle brilliant conversation . [I]0-i made a few little reminding notes on the menû card . [Mrs. Purdick]232-mrs. purdick happened to say : " [You]229-mr. huttle are certainly unorthodox , [Mr. Huttle]229-mr. huttle . "[232-mrs. purdick] [Mr. Huttle]229-mr. huttle , with a peculiar expression ( [I]0-i can see it now ) said in a slow rich voice : " [Mrs. Purdick]232-mrs. purdick , ' orthodox ' is a grandiloquent word implying sticking - in - the - mud . If [Columbus]235-columbus and [Stephenson]236-stephenson had been [orthodox]1767-orthodox , there would neither have been the discovery of [America]6-america nor the steam - engine . "[229-mr. huttle] There was quite a silence . It appeared to [me]0-i that such teaching was absolutely dangerous , and yet [I]0-i felt - in fact [we]1261-we must all have felt - there was no answer to the argument . "[232-mrs. purdick] [I]0-i shall never forget the effect the words , " happy medium , "[229-mr. huttle] had upon [him]229-mr. huttle . "[79-lupin] [Poor boy]1303-poor boy , [I]0-i fear [he]1303-poor boy is perfectly hopeless . It took [me]0-i nearly the whole day to write to [Mr. Crowbillon]239-mr. crowbillon . "[94-mrs. james] May 26,Sunday - [We]1309-we went to [Sutton]12-sutton after dinner to have meat - tea with [Mr.]1310-mr. and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james . It was quite painful for an hour afterwards . When [I]0-i came [home]287-home in the evening [I]0-i found [Carrie]73-carrie buried in a book on Spiritualism , called There is no Birth , by [Florence Singleyet]252-florence singleyet . [I]0-i need scarcely say the book was sent [her]73-carrie to read by [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , of [Sutton]12-sutton . As [she]94-mrs. james had not a word to say outside [her]94-mrs. james book , [I]0-i spent the rest of the evening altering the stair - carpets , which are beginning to show signs of wear at the edges . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james arrived and , as usual , in the evening took the entire management of everything . Finding that [she]94-mrs. james and [Carrie]73-carrie were making some preparations for table - turning , [I]0-i thought it time really to put [my]0-i foot down . [I]0-i have always had the greatest contempt for such nonsense , and put an end to it years ago when [Carrie]73-carrie , at [[our]1329-our old house]1330-our old house , used to have séances every night with [poor Mrs. Fussters]253-poor mrs. fussters ( who is now dead ) . If [I]0-i could see any use in it , [I]0-i would not care . As [I]0-i stopped it in the days gone by , [I]0-i determined to do so now . "[0-i] [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said : " Do [you]0-i mean to say [you]0-i have n't read There is no Birth ? [I]94-mrs. james said : "[94-mrs. james] No , and [I]0-i have no intention of doing so . " [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james seemed surprised and said : "[94-mrs. james] All [the world]389-the world is going mad over the book . " [I]94-mrs. james responded rather cleverly : "[94-mrs. james] Let it . There will be [one sane man]1332-one sane man in it , at all events . " [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said [she]94-mrs. james thought [I]1332-one sane man was very unkind , and if [people]541-people were all as prejudiced as [I]1332-one sane man was , there would never have been the electric telegraph or the telephone . [I]1332-one sane man said that was quite a different thing . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said sharply : "[1332-one sane man] In what way , pray - in what way ? " [Sarah]85-sarah at this moment opened the door and showed in [Cummings]251-cummings , for which [I]0-i was thankful , for [I]0-i felt it would put a stop to this foolish table - turning . [I]0-i firmly declined to take any part in it , with the result that [my]0-i presence was ignored . [May 31.-I]241-may 14.-lupin wrote a stern letter to [the laundress]874-the laundress . More table - turning in the evening . [Carrie]73-carrie said last night was in a measure successful , and [they]1862-they ought to sit again . [Cummings]251-cummings came in , and seemed interested . [June]119-june 1.-I sat reluctantly at the table in the evening , and [I]1333-i am bound to admit some curious things happened . [I]1333-i contend they were coincidences , but [they]1862-they were curious . For instance , the table kept tilting towards [me]1333-i , which [Carrie]73-carrie construed as a desire that [I]1333-i should ask [the spirit]1867-the spirit a question . [I]1333-i obeyed the rules , and [I]1333-i asked the spirit ( who said [her]1867-the spirit name was [Lina]73-carrie ) if [she]1867-the spirit could tell [me]1333-i the name of [an old aunt of whom [I]1333-i was thinking , and whom [we]1869-we used to call [Aunt Maggie]255-daisy]1868-an old aunt of whom i was thinking , and whom we used to call aunt maggie . [We]1869-we could make nothing out of it , till [I]1333-i suddenly remembered that [her]1867-the spirit second name was [Catherine]256-catherine , which it was evidently trying to spell . [June 3.-The laundress]1334-june 3.-the laundress called , and said [she]1334-june 3.-the laundress was very sorry about the handkerchiefs , and returned ninepence . [I]0-i said , as the colour was completely washed out and the handkerchiefs quite spoiled , ninepence was not enough . [I]0-i must say [I]0-i feel very uncomfortable about it . [Carrie]73-carrie said [I]0-i was ridiculous to worry about it . In the evening [we]1338-we had another séance , which , in some respects , was very remarkable , although the first part of it was a little doubtful . [Gowing]76-gowing called , as well as [Cummings]251-cummings , and begged to be allowed to join the circle . [I]0-i wanted to object , but [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , who appears [a good Medium]1339-a good medium ( that is , if there is anything in it at all ) , thought there might be a little more spirit - power if [Gowing]76-gowing joined ; so [the five of [us]1338-we]1340-the five of us sat down . [Gowing]76-gowing shouted out : " Way , oh ! steady , [lad]1870-lad , steady ! "[76-gowing] [I]0-i told [Gowing]76-gowing if [he]76-gowing could not behave [himself]76-gowing [I]0-i should light the gas , and put an end to the séance . [The spirit Lina]73-carrie came again , and said , " WARN "[73-carrie] three or four times , and declined to explain . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said " [Lina]73-carrie "[94-mrs. james] was stubborn sometimes . [She]73-carrie often behaved like that , and the best thing to do was to send [her]73-carrie away . [She]73-carrie then hit the table sharply , and said : " Go away , [Lina]73-carrie ; [you]73-carrie are disagreeable . Go away ! "[73-carrie] [I]0-i should think [we]1342-we sat nearly three - quarters of an hour with nothing happening . [My]0-i hands felt quite cold , and [I]0-i suggested [we]1342-we should stop the séance . [Carrie]73-carrie and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , as well as [Cummings]251-cummings , would not agree to it . In about ten minutes ' time there was some tilting towards [me]0-i . [I]0-i gave the alphabet , and it spelled out S P O O F. As [I]0-i have heard both [Gowing]76-gowing and [Lupin]79-lupin use the word , and as [I]0-i could hear [Gowing]76-gowing silently laughing , [I]0-i directly accused [him]76-gowing of pushing the table . [He]76-gowing denied it ; but , [I]0-i regret to say , [I]0-i did not believe [him]76-gowing . [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Perhaps it means ' [Spook]257-spook , ' a ghost . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i said : " [You]76-gowing know it does n't mean anything of the sort . "[0-i] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " Oh ! very well - [I'm]76-gowing sorry [I]76-gowing ' spook , ' "[76-gowing] and [he]76-gowing rose from the table . [No one]1450-no one took any notice of the stupid joke , and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james suggested [he]76-gowing should sit out for a while . [Gowing]76-gowing consented and sat in the arm - chair . The table began to move again , and [we]1344-we might have had a wonderful séance but for [Gowing]76-gowing 's stupid interruptions . In answer to the alphabet from [Carrie]73-carrie the table spelt " NIPUL , "[73-carrie] then the " WARN "[94-mrs. james] three times . [We]1344-we could not think what it meant till [Cummings]251-cummings pointed out that " NIPUL "[251-cummings] was [Lupin]79-lupin spelled backwards . This was quite exciting . [Carrie]73-carrie was particularly excited , and said [she]73-carrie hoped nothing horrible was going to happen . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james asked if " [Lina]73-carrie "[1867-the spirit] was [the spirit]1867-the spirit . The table replied firmly , " No , "[94-mrs. james] and [the spirit]1867-the spirit would not give [his]1347-his or [her]1348-her name . [We]1344-we then had the message , " NIPUL will be very rich . "[73-carrie] [Carrie]73-carrie said [she]73-carrie felt quite relieved , but the word " WARN "[73-carrie] was again spelt out . The table then began to oscillate violently , and in reply to [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james , who spoke very softly to the table , the spirit began to spell [its]1867-the spirit name . [It]1349-it first spelled " DRINK . "[1349-it] [Gowing]76-gowing here said : " Ah ! that 's more in [my]76-gowing line . "[76-gowing] [I]0-i asked [him]76-gowing to be quiet as the name might not be completed . The table then spelt " WATER . "[76-gowing] [Gowing]76-gowing here interrupted again , and said : " Ah ! that 's not in [my]76-gowing line . Outside if [you]73-carrie like , but not inside . "[76-gowing] [Carrie]73-carrie appealed to [him]76-gowing to be quiet . The table then spelt " [CAPTAIN]1871-captain , "[94-mrs. james] and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james startled [us]1344-we by crying out , " [Captain Drinkwater]258-captain drinkwater , [a very old friend of [[my]94-mrs. james father]1873-my father 's , who has been dead some years]1872-a very old friend of my father 's , who has been dead some years . "[94-mrs. james] This was more interesting , and [I]0-i could not help thinking that after all there must be something in Spiritualism . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james asked [the spirit]1867-the spirit to interpret the meaning of the word " Warn "[94-mrs. james] as applied to " NIPUL . "[94-mrs. james] The alphabet was given again , and [we]1344-we got the word " BOSH . "[76-gowing] [Gowing]76-gowing here muttered : " So it is . "[76-gowing] [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said [she]94-mrs. james did not think the spirit meant that , as [Captain Drinkwater]258-captain drinkwater was [a perfect gentleman]1062-a perfect gentleman , and would never have used the word in answer to [a lady]1352-a lady 's question . Accordingly the alphabet was given again . This time the table spelled distinctly " POSH . "[1344-we] [We]1344-we all thought of [Mrs. Murray Posh]254-mrs. murray posh and [Lupin]79-lupin . [Carrie]73-carrie was getting a little distressed , and as it was getting late [we]1344-we broke up the circle . [We]1344-we arranged to have one more to - morrow , as it will be [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james ' last night in [town]339-town . [We]1344-we also determined not to have [Gowing]76-gowing present . [Cummings]251-cummings , before leaving , said it was certainly interesting , but [he]251-cummings wished the spirits would say something about [him]251-cummings . [June]119-june 4.-Quite looking forward to the séance this evening . Was thinking of it all the day at [the office]323-the office . Just as [we]1344-we sat down at the table [we]1344-we were annoyed by [Gowing]76-gowing entering without knocking . [He]251-cummings said : " [I]251-cummings am not going to stop , but [I]251-cummings have brought with [me]251-cummings a sealed envelope , which [I]251-cummings know [I]251-cummings can trust with [Mrs. Pooter]104-mrs. pooter . "[251-cummings] [I]0-i ventured the expression that it might be impossible . [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said : " Oh no ! it is of common occurrence for [the spirits]1874-the spirits to answer questions under such conditions - and even for [them]1874-the spirits to write on locked slates . "[94-mrs. james] [Gowing]76-gowing said : " All right ; then [I]76-gowing shall be [a firm believer]1875-a firm believer . " [Lina]73-carrie "[94-mrs. james] took a long time answering the question , but eventually spelt out " ROSES , LILIES , AND [COWS]259-cows . "[94-mrs. james] There was great rocking of the table at this time , and [Mrs. James]94-mrs. james said : " If that is [Captain Drinkwater]258-captain drinkwater , let [us]1355-we ask [him]258-captain drinkwater the answer as well ? "[1357-the captain] [I]0-i can not describe the agitation with which [Carrie]73-carrie broke the seal , or the disappointment [we]1355-we felt on reading the question , to which the answer was so inappropriate . [You]0-i can never be sufficiently thanked . Let [us]1415-our change the subject . Do [you]0-i like [[your]0-i house]1692-your house , and are [you]0-i happy where [you]0-i are ? "[88-mr. perkupp] [I]0-i replied : " Yes , [sir]1428-sir ; [I]0-i love [[my]0-i house]1513-my house and [I]0-i love [the neighbourhood]1217-the neighbourhood , and could not bear to leave [it]1513-my house . "[0-i] [Mr. Perkupp]88-mr. perkupp , to [my]0-i surprise , said : " [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , [I]88-mr. perkupp will purchase the freehold of [that house]1908-that house , and present [it]1908-that house to [the most honest and most worthy man it has ever been [my]88-mr. perkupp lot to meet]1909-the most honest and most worthy man it has ever been my lot to meet . "[88-mr. perkupp] [He]88-mr. perkupp shook [my]0-i hand , and said [he]88-mr. perkupp hoped [[my]0-i wife]1695-my wife and [I]0-i would be spared many years to enjoy it . [My]0-i heart was too full to thank [him]88-mr. perkupp ; and , seeing [my]0-i embarrassment , [the good fellow]1419-the good fellow said : " [You]0-i need say nothing , [Mr. Pooter]109-mr. pooter , "[1419-the good fellow] and left [the office]323-the office . [I]0-i sent telegrams to [Carrie]73-carrie , [Gowing]76-gowing , and [Cummings]251-cummings ( a thing [I]0-i have never done before ) , and asked [the two latter]1421-the two latter to come round to supper . On arriving [home]287-home [I]0-i found [Carrie]73-carrie crying with joy , and [I]0-i sent [Sarah]85-sarah round to [the grocer]357-the grocer 's to get two bottles of " Jackson Frères . "[0-i] [[My]0-i two dear friends]1424-my two dear friends came in the evening , and the last post brought a letter from [Lupin]79-lupin in reply to [mine]0-i . [I]0-i read it aloud to [them]1424-my two dear friends all . [It]1425-i ran : " [[My]1425-i dear old Guv]1910-my dear old guv . ,-Keep [your]1910-my dear old guv hair on . [You]1910-my dear old guv are on the wrong tack again . [I]1425-i am engaged to be married to ' [Lillie Girl]267-lillie girl . ' [I]1425-i did not mention it last Thursday , as it was not definitely settled . [We]1911-we shall be married in August , and amongst [[our]1911-we guests]1912-our guests [we]1911-we hope to see [[your]1910-my dear old guv old friends]1913-your old friends [Gowing]76-gowing and [Cummings]251-cummings . With much love to all , from [The same old Lupin]79-lupin . "[1425-i]
